It is no reflection on this particular model but if I was to purchase another camera I would buy a newer model with encryption features, which this model does not have. Encryption deters camera thieves because without the encryption codes the camera and memory chip are useless. BTW - I use one of my cameras for security at my recreational property and it has already provided me with photos of a break-in and allowed me to identify the thief. That alone made the camera worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Wildlife Cam
Reviews.Author: Traveling On
Reviews.Content: Great little Camera. This makes my second one. Only negative is on really overcast days aperture doesn'nt seem to make the transition from dusk til dawn very well, leaves the picture very dark. Not enough to erase a 5 star rating though.I'd buy another

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price...
Reviews.Author: Ryan Hanan
Reviews.Content: I have two of these and I have been using them for about a week. I can say the night time videos are much better than the night time photos. Motion blur is a problem with photos at close range at night if the subject is on the move...(motion blur is the worst at 12 feet or less.) The night videos on the other hand look great. No blur. Daytime photos are pretty good too. You can easily make out details in the photos. I am using the 8MP setting for photos. LED's on the camera glow red when they are on, so you can see the camera at night and all of the animals I filmed seemed to be interested in the camera to some degree when it was taking photos or videos at night. The motion sensor can be triggered farther than 45 feet. I pointed it towards a roadway which was about 60 feet away and it triggered every time a car passed.The menu screen is kind of OLD SCHOOL and the buttons work but look junky. I think this could be improved. The up, down, left, right buttons are in a single row not in the shape of their wording. I would have placed the buttons like tradition devices where you have an up button on top, a down button on the bottom, the left button on the left and the right button on the right with the OK button in the middle.....duh! Their layout works but its 1990's looking and slightly confusing to use. I would expect more ease of use in a 2011 model. The menu is very simple to use and navigate once you get used to the dumb button configuration. You can not review photos on this models screen. You can attach it to a TV with the included cord or your computer, also with the included cord but I prefer to use multiple SD cards and just swap them out when I visit the camera. Trust me you don't want to have to disconnect the camera from a tree everytime you want to see what is on it. Get 2 SD cards!Some reviewers should note that first production units of this and other models had problems like pinkish images but there are several firmware patches available from Bushnell's website to fix those problems. There are very clear instructions to follow which tell you which models and which serial numbers need to be updated. You have to hunt around to find this on their site but its there.Overall a pretty good camera for the money. Only 4 stars because of the night time motion blur.

Reviews.Title: BEST CRITTER CAM FOR THE PRICE!!
Reviews.Author: Jim "4x5kid"
Reviews.Content: This is my third critter cam and this is the best.  Technology has come a long way.  It has some many features, adjustable mb for photo quality, great for night vision photos, night flash that you can't see, runs forever on eight AA batteries, I use a 16gb card and can leave the camera on the trail for approx five days then plug the card into my digital camera review them in it as it is quicker, erase the ones I don't want, then downloard the rest to my laptop and print out the pics to show my buddies.  Great camera, great program with easy to understand set up procedures.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND this camer to hunter, heck buy several and cover even more ground.

Reviews.Title: Great shots and easy to use.
Reviews.Author: P. Allen "rocksrus"
Reviews.Content: Fairly easy to set up. Make sure the batteries are in tight. They can fall out if you bang it around. The night time shots are crisp and great details. One shot in the evening was excellent quality. I am seeing feral cats and racoons crossing trails. No deer yet. I would buy this again, as the price can't be beat and the quality of the shots are super.

Reviews.Title: Great field cam - easy set up and clear photos and videos in all weathers
Reviews.Author: uktravailer
Reviews.Content: I have owned the Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam Night Vision Trail Camera for about 18 months now and been very pleased with all aspects of the camera. It has been set up in all weathers and performed well throughout a wide range of temperatures (9F to 120F in the last year!), snow, rain and direct sunlight, without any problems whatsoever. The battery life is astounding and having 2 x 4 AA banks that allow the camera to maintain power even when switching out one bank is good design that saves having to reset the camera every time you change batteries.The IR is clear, although there is a distict hot spot that can cause significant reflection if large animals are too close to the camera. The color video is good quality too and the ability to have time lapse on still pictures (in both color and IR) at 8MP is excellent.shotsThere are many combinations of sensitivity settings and timings, such as delays, length of video, number of still shots, etc., it just takes a bit of experimenting to set up the way you want it to perform for your situation.Overall a highly recommended piece of gear.

Reviews.Title: love the camera
Reviews.Author: jerseyhunter
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera its not to expensive and takes beautiful pictures the only problem I've had is that the clips to pull the camera tight to the tree broke the first time I took it out..other then that great camera

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Robert Ingram
Reviews.Content: I am reviewing the Bushnell 8MP trophy Cam.  We have had this cam for a little over 5 months now.  Has taken great pictures on a cattle trail on my parents property.  Check out the pictures of the bucks that I added to the item description.  I will update my review for the video portion soon.We have a 16GB card in there and on the 8MP setting, it took 432 pictures in a month and barely even put a dent in card memory. We recently switched it so now it is taking 15 second video, so it will be interesting to see what the quality of the video looks like and how much space it takes up on the card.  I will be posting videos soon!

Reviews.Title: Another Great Product for the Money!
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: Used this camera for the rest of the WI archery season.  Pictures were good, and trigger speed was excellent.  I did think that some of the pics came out just a tad blurry, but after I adjusted the distance to the trail I was monitoring, they cleared right up.  The IR pics were good too.  Battery life (I used 8 regular alkaline AA's)was great, and I was amazed at how long they lasted.  The only thing to remember is, if you plan on putting your camera on a bait, and having 3 burst mode, at 15-20 sec intervals (or less), you're going to lose battery power much more quickly.  You'll get plenty of pics, but they'll be redundant.  Not that it matters, with an 8 GB card, but it does tax the batteries.  It's compact, A BREEZE to set up, and has a ton of settings to play around with.  You can look up the user manual on line at Bushnell and get an idea of what you're dealing with as far as set up is concerned, and by the time you get your camera, you'll be a pro!

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly!
Reviews.Author: cabin lover
Reviews.Content: I also own a cuddleback but the bushnell is so great in battery life...I live in northern Minnesota where the winters are pretty brutal..batteries are still going strong after 4 months and down to 10 below zero with howling winds...got excellent pictures of creatures and trespassers on our property..plan on buying another one soon..

Reviews.Title: Bush ell Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Riffee
Reviews.Content: This trophy cam is awesome. We have used it for several weeks and have captured digital pictures of trophy bucks. The resolution and color are amazing. I highly recommend this trail cam for any outdoor enthusiast.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for about two months.  I've taken over an hour of videos, and well over a hundred stills.  It been on for most of the two months and with only four AA batteries it indicates the batteries are full.  With it set at 3 MP it takes great daytime pixs.  Night is good for about 30 feet.  The trigger speed is very good.  The temps have been up to 50 degrees and down to 8 degrees.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Cam
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: This Camera is great, especially for the price we paid. It takes great pictures and takes them quickly. The camera is placed in a tree that overlooks the construction of our house.

Reviews.Title: INOP
Reviews.Author: kk
Reviews.Content: Either the camera or the motion detection does not work. My intention was to contact the seller to try and come to a resolution, but the only option is to rate the product. Because it is INOP, I am not satisfied - especially with the amount of money that I have paid. If a company representative reads these, please contact me and I will re-rate.

Reviews.Title: The product does what it says.
Reviews.Author: ABC
Reviews.Content: The product does what it says.  Just one minor thing, when the camera tilted downward, and the front cover opened to turn camera on, the weight of batteries pulling the electric contact loose, and the setup reverted to factory default.  A piece of cardboard inserted to pop up the batteries solves the problem.

Reviews.Title: DOA right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: From other reviews, I know others have at screen issues with this product, but I took a chance and lost. Screen does not turn on. To add injury to insult, I was two days over amazon's return policy before I tried to turn it on. This is a obvious tip, but always try anything you buy on Amazon right when you receive. Guess my only option is to now send to Bushnell.

Reviews.Title: Trail camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin F
Reviews.Content: The fact that I now own 10 of these with more purchases in the near future on tap should say all I need to on these cameras.  The battery life is great.  It will actually work a year on one set of batteries.  I put them out in the spring and take them down before winter sets in hard and have never, ever experienced dead batteries.  There is only one complaint from me and the fix was easy.  It motion sensor will actually pick up a animal before it's in the field of view of the camera itself so you get some empty pictures or pictures with only half a animal (which isn't all that big a problem if it's the front half).  The fix was to put a very small strip of black paint from the hobby store down each side of the motion sensor.  Now I rarely get empty images.For the price you won't be disappointed in these cameras.  I'd recommend this product to anybody wanting to know what's going on in the woods near them... or even around your home/property.

Reviews.Title: door gasket leaks
Reviews.Author: dougfir
Reviews.Content: water collects in the case and the camera does not work. seems to be a common problem, should have googled it first.

Reviews.Title: Trapping
Reviews.Author: Nick Oilar
Reviews.Content: I found these to work great for day time pics, but night time the object must be almost completely still of you will have a blurry pic. I have 2 and a friend that has 5+ and we both think their is room for improvement for night photos.

Reviews.Title: A great value, great quality
Reviews.Author: C. Pellerin
Reviews.Content: Infrared video picks up wildlife movement even at night, without the motion sensor being turned on by rain, snow, etc.  We have been entertained by a fox, raccoon, and squirrels so far.  The picture quality is really amazing.  My only complaint is that there is a lag time of a few seconds from the device sensing motion and the camera turning on, so we have missed some fleet-footed visitors.  We are very impressed with the quality of the equipment for the price.

Reviews.Title: Game cameras are a crap shoot - this one is OK
Reviews.Author: AUgie the Prospector
Reviews.Content: This camera has held up so far, for perhaps 6 months use (it wasn't out in the heat of mid-summer).  Every game camera, with perhaps a few recent (and expensive) exceptions, seems to have quality and performance issues.  This one, at least, is still going, and gets decent photos much of the time.I've stuck with still photos, in bursts of 3, and high motion sensitivity most of the time, so this review won't evaluate the video capabilities - though I may give them a try some day.  I run it a 5 MP, which appears to be the "sweet spot" in quality for this camera, I believe that the 8 MP photos are oversampled  (going from memory here!)A common failing of game cameras is taking night photos in the early twilight or day photos in the late twilight - thus giving massively over or under exposed photos, just at the time most animals are active.  This one has only done that a couple of times (another popular brand makes a RULE of mis-exposing such photos!).It is generally out behind the house, sitting on the ground and pointed up the mountain slope toward a large boulder, as there is a game trail just this side of that boulder.  There is the issue of lots of false exposures on very windy days, where the swaying of the creosote bushes trigger it - but I like the high sensitivity to catch small animals at some distance, so just delete the extra photos.  That only happens once every few weeks (there aren't many bushes right there to begin with).I live in the Mohave desert, so heat, not cold, is the issue here.  So far, it has held up to the heat OK, though I've avoid exposing it to the sun during the blast-furnace days of summer.  It has been out in several days of rain and drizzle - again with no ill effects.You do lose sensitivity during the heat (which the instructions indicate).  When everything is hot, the heat of an animal just doesn't stand out to the sensor.  In sub-100 degree temperatures, maximum sensitivity gets the job done - though nothing like when the temperature is lower and much better range for smaller animals is common - but this is going to be an issue for most any IR sensor game camera.Similarly, the IR feature is a mixed bag, as with most all of these cameras.  Overexposed on the close ones, underexposed on the far ones, and blurry if there is any significant movement at all.  I don't think any reasonably priced game camera avoids these issues (though they do make a few flash units that take color flash photos at night - to the consternation of the animals photographed, I'm sure!  Blurring on motion of the night photos is the biggest issue, and it is certainly an issue.  I haven't looked carefully to see if other cameras shorten the exposure enough to help in that area.I get photos of passing quail all the time, occasionally a dove or cactus wren.  Occasionally a rabbit (desert cotton-tail - the jack rabbits are seen nearby, but not right here, even on the mountain for some reason).  A local bobcat has been photographed both night and day.  We got a night shot of a kit fox - I've never seen one around here, but they obviously are.One of the weaknesses of these cameras is their shutter delay.  This one is proud of its short delay, but there are better (and worse) ones.  Where I have it sitting, a lot of animals pass very close to it.  For fast moving ones, all you get is the tail in one photo and nothing in the next two of the 3 shot burst.  Coyotes are usually fast movers, so they are blurred (at night) and often only a tail or hind-quarter is seen.  Similarly road runners - I get the distinctive tail, if anything.  Bobcats, rabbits, mountain sheep, many birds, you get the whole critter, often in all three shots.  For night shots, the click of the IR filter being retracted will often attract their attention and you get a nice "posed" shot with them looking toward the camera.  That, and perhaps the dim glow of the IR, seems to attract their attention, but not scare them away.  Works for the bobcat and rabbit, but not for the coyotes or foxes.Battery life has been "OK".  It is on its second set of batteries (that I can recall), and I only put in 4 at a time.  With the heat, putting in all 8 might not help much with longevity (as it should), since the heat may kill them as fast as the current drain.  One irritation: replacing the 4 batteries causes loss of date and time, requiring it to be reset.  I'll experiment with temporarily adding batteries up to 8 before replacing the first 4 to see if that avoids that minor hassle.  (Whether a warning about that is in the manual, I don't recall.)At least the menu and controls aren't too difficult.  Between the simple graphic button labels and a little experimentation, they are quickly re-mastered each time they are required, without consulting the manual.Photo reliability has been so-so.  Every once in a while I get a partial photo (top half or 2/3 only), or an unreadable photo.  Once, I had to do a "repair" on the directory structure of the SD card in Windows 7 to get it to display the photos.  Obviously, there are occasional glitches in the writing of a photo, with bad photos or even a messed up directory entry resulting.  So far, that has only been a minor irritation - resulting in one photo of a group of 3 being bad every great once in a while.I bring in the camera and download photos every week or two (it is right behind the house, I could do it daily if I wanted).  It is a bit of a chore to go through the false wind photos, all the quail photos, etc., and looking carefully at each one for some small animal not immediately apparent in the background.  Nearly every time however, we are rewarded with a nice photo or two of some rarely seen animal.This isn't a great game camera - and Bushnell has already brought out new models with significant claimed improvements.  However, for the price (I paid $140, which is still the current Amazon price), it may be about as good as you're going to get.  (At least as of earlier in 2013, when I bought it).If you want a game camera for the back yard, to get decent quality photos, in a variety of lighting situations, of not too rapidly moving animals, at a "reasonable" price, this one is a good choice.  For more demanding situations (fast moving game, very difficult lighting, critical uses like isolated hard-to-reach hunting locations), I'd want something more reliable taking and recording photos, quicker on the shutter, etc. - and I'd end up paying a lot more for it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice. I love it
Reviews.Author: Steven T Bowen
Reviews.Content: Very nice. I love it. We found out who our chicken killer was. A 300lb black bear. The time of night is great. The sound is also great. I use it every night. See foxes, skunks, you name it. They are busted. Know the time they come in.

Reviews.Title: Bad Battery Setup
Reviews.Author: Teena Wharton
Reviews.Content: Batteries will not stay in.  Every time I open it the batteries come out and I have to reset the time, date, and photo settings.  Annoying!!  Takes good pics, but this needs to be addressed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for catching elusive creatures
Reviews.Author: JoAnn Reed "Chandraleila"
Reviews.Content: I got this as a birthday gift for my father who is an outdoor wildlife enthusiast and loves photographing and recording animals but had thus far been unable to do so at night. The main animal he was looking to catch were the many frisky black bear that tend to roam our neck of the woods (literally) but only after dark. After receiving this gift he tied it to a tree near where he'd seen tracks and has since had hundreds of wonderful, vibrantly detailed pictures of our large guests.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, a couple drawbacks.
Reviews.Author: Jesse Schneider
Reviews.Content: These cameras are a decent value.  I've had a number of issues related to card formatting (likely user error).  I own other cameras that aren't as finiky with formatting (read: don't need to format them every single time), which I would prefer.  I missed out on several weeks of pictures due to not formatting a card.Pictures are decent, but not great.  They'll definitely show you what is out there, but you won't be doing any prints from them.Battery life is good, size is great (small).  I recommend the CamLockBox to keep these as safe as possible.

Reviews.Title: Both cameras have quit working
Reviews.Author: Harold Willhelm
Reviews.Content: These units were purchased on August 15 2013. They were placed into the field and the first unit would snap a picture every ten seconds. This was what the timer was set for, only it is supposed to wait for a triger such as movment or a heat signature. Talked with Bushnell and tried their test of different memory cards etc.. Still takes pictures without a triggering event. The second unit works like my older units only it appears that you are taking pictures of ghost? The pictures are blurry and antler detail is non existant. Had the cameras out for two and a half weeks. Talked to Bushnell and they wanted them sent back to Amazon. Return window is closed with Amazon so now getting the run around with Bushnell. I do not beleve Bushnell to be as reputable or dependable as they once were. I have a range finder that is bullet proof. We have some old field glasses and a couple of old scopes that were also built good. These cameras are not of the same quality and in talking with them I beleive they are ware of it, they just do not care.

Reviews.Title: Already had one - bought a second.
Reviews.Author: Harrie
Reviews.Content: We already had one - and love the pictures we get off it.  My husband goes out almost every day and swaps out the memory card, brings in the old one and downloads the pictures.  We've gotten lots of deer, ravens, a couple of coyotes, raccoons, etc.  It's really interesting to see what's prowling around in the back of your property!!  The pictures are very clear, even when you need to enlarge them after they've been downloaded (this pertains to both the night shots and the day shots).

Reviews.Title: Close it up good...Great customer service
Reviews.Author: landscaperhi
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a couple years ago and I forgot to close the little rubber plug on the bottom of the unit for the 6V battery adapter, and a few days later I had a colony of ants living in the camera. It worked a few more times and then it finally wouldn't work anymore. I sent it back to Bushnell and with no questions asked they sent me a replacement camera (refurbished but it works) immediately. Anyways it works great but you need to make sure the tree you put it on doesn't move around in the wind or if you have a lot of tall grass that moves in the wind in front of it you'll get a lot of false triggers. The video works really good on this unit too. I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good results but died
Reviews.Author: Richard.
Reviews.Content: It worked well for a while. Then no sign of life from the LCD or anything else. While browsing here to look for a replacement (I don't do returns generally, even if that were possible), I had the idea of plugging the USB in. No problems with that. Oddly there were 3 pix in there even though there was no SD card. It turns out they have 20mB of on board memory (according to Windows). By the date stamps on those, it seems this thing lasted about 6 months (it died several months ago).When I put an SD card in, the other memory no longer showed up. But either way, the interface into the device and the card seem to be fine. I tried to trigger some photos, but nothing doing there. Also, there was no DCIM directory created on the SD card. So, I guess the brains of this thing are fried, but the power supply and interface are fine.Too bad. I kind of liked it, but I guess I will try something else or see if a more invasive postmortem can find anything (unlikely, but nothing to lose).... While taking it apart, it started taking pictures again onto the internal memory. The LCD is still dead, but it seems that the switch is working OK -- a little red motion sensor LED comes on in the setup phase. Who knows, maybe I can coax some more life out of it anyway.

Reviews.Title: slow response time
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews are fine about quality of images/video.  This camera is the only one with which I've experience but I'm disappointed in the delay of the motion sensor before recording starts.  Judging by the ambling of a raccoon in my yard, the delay is perhaps >30 seconds --the raccoon was well into the field of view, and walking out before recording started.  I'm trying to determine where the racoons are entering my yard and all I see is them walking around, never the entry point in my fence/gate.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: craig
Reviews.Content: I have Camaras from 4 other manufacturers, some have faster shutter speeds but all of them seem to have similar quality pictures. The Bushnells are the easiest to set up, operate, have the longest battery life and have been the most dependable. I get 4,000 plus pictures per camara during a typical year in both Albama and Michigan where I do most of my hunting.

Reviews.Title: Ah...The Secret Lives of Raccoons
Reviews.Author: CQ2HIFI
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera after comparing several similar models.We are pleased, and never expected images worthy of publication in National Geographic.That said, what a thrill to see the raccoons, fox, coyote, and even what appears to be an alien separated from its spacecraft...OK maybe it was wombat with an attitude. We only use the camera at night, and really don't care about the daylight pictures. Good quality overall--and just what we wanted to see what happens in the backyard. Great battery life and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Easy, but not sophisticated
Reviews.Author: Sandra Cooper
Reviews.Content: I got this to see who is living in the hole outside my kitchen window. It did the job. And more. However, the flash at night obscures part of the frame. I understand the more recent version corrects this.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: Willie
Reviews.Content: The camera takes good photos day or night but the field of view is not very wide. You have to open the lid to turn the camera off and then to setup in order to view the photos and every time I do the batteries come loose and the settings change, including the time and date.

Reviews.Title: Good for catchin thieves
Reviews.Author: Mr. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. Very nice pictures and videos, even on the low pixel setting. Audio on videos is pretty clear too. We use them for security at my business. Although we also have security cameras they are a pain to find something that may be going on. With these game cameras all you need to do is check the date and time stamp and then you also know right where to rewind the regular camera to.

Reviews.Title: First Trail Cam and pleased.  Only a couple minor issues.
Reviews.Author: Naiwt Kram "Sam"
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera because I liked the AA battery option and read good reviews on the battery life.  It works as advertised and I have some great footage.  I have found two issues that I don't like.- In video mode, every video has a slight glitch a few seconds into the video.  Like a couple frames are lost?  It's not a big deal, but a little annoying.- The batteries are not retained very well.  Just a little bumping around while you are setting it up and the batteries come loose.  Then you get to set the time and date again.Everything else is great.I will also mention that I didn't by the camo camera and regretted that the first time I set it up.  It stood out like a sore thumb when I strapped it to an oak tree, so I was worried someone might steal it.  I bought some camo tape and did my own camo job.  It just makes it blend in much better so if someone does happen to stroll by they are unlikely to see it.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8mp
Reviews.Author: Lucky88
Reviews.Content: While pictures during the daylight are decent, the night time shots so far are a disappointment. Within 10 feet at night are ok

Reviews.Title: Optical problem.
Reviews.Author: Marco Saborio
Reviews.Content: It is unfortunate that the only problem I found on this camera is in the optics, the lens seems to have a small disalignment that produces an image slightly out of focus in the lower right  corner.  However this could be a problem in this particular camera only,except for  this the camera is very good. I will report this directly to Bushnell.

Reviews.Title: As advertised.
Reviews.Author: TAKER
Reviews.Content: This was a great trail cam as advertised,color photo or video duing daylight, and infrared no flash black and white night pictures so not to spook game. Buschnell is a trusted name brandhowever mine stopped functioning after 4 days so I returned it for full credit, did not want a replacement. As always, Amazon paid return shipping and credit back including my original price,shipping and tax.These are the new state of the art smaller compact type.But I went back to another same model Stealth cam I had used for 5 yrs untill it quit.And though it does not have the infrared no flash at night, the game do not spook anyway and I get great color night pictures which are much better and more clear of anything that is in motion.Deer, rabbits ect, large or small, I will stick with Stealth personally.

Reviews.Title: awesome game camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Garrett
Reviews.Content: it has worked awesome for me i have not had any problems at all and easy to use i am buying 2 more

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Pugsbrew
Reviews.Content: Arrived as advertised.  I have other cams of this make and they all do a great job,  This one is no exception.  Need photos for positioning those hunting stands, look no further.  Of course, this is my experience with the product.  I'm sure there will be opposing commentary.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam Standard Edition
Reviews.Author: A. Herron

} } } Length:: 1:03 MinsThe trail cam works well. We have enjoyed watching the wild life that roams around our yard at night. Here is a nice Mule Deer Buck we caught in our back yard. We've seen skunks and racoons also.

Reviews.Title: Trail Cam.
Reviews.Author: Mn5150
Reviews.Content: I Bought This to Replace a Older Trail Camera In My Backyard,This Camera is Superior to the last one!!Very Clear Pictures,Very Easy To Program!!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the Bushnell Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: laurieo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera through Amazon and am using it in South Africa where we are living out in the bush.  We've used it in different locations around our property to see which animals are frequenting it and have had great results.  The daylight photos are very clear with good color and detail (we've mainly been using the 8MP setting).  The nighttime photos are fairly grainy and a bit noisy when enlarged, but, hell, it's taking photos in the dark without flash and you can ID the animals.  Using the Field Scan option at night is not as effective as it's difficult to see anything clearly that isn't in the immediate range.  Animals in motion can be a bit blurry. The only problem we've had so far is when we were working it too much (Field Scan on for several hours, every minute) we would get "Unrecognized format" or similar messages on some of the frames.The camera has gotten quite hot at times and has weathered quite a bit of rain without issue after daily use for a month.  We used 8 Energizer lithium batteries as recommended by the manufacturer for the first 2 or 3 weeks.  These were supposed to last a year(!), but we did use the camera a lot, on the highest settings and also tried some video.  Have switched to rechargeable batteries which work great for us.  Haven't really gotten into the video feature so far, but seems to work fine.Oh - one more thing.  Not sure why they call this model "brown" as you can see from the photo that it is black.  Not an issue for our use.

Reviews.Title: bushnell 8mp trophy cam
Reviews.Author: donb
Reviews.Content: This is the best trail camera I have. I have 4 others.  The pictures are clear both day and night.  The battery life is great.  I have had zero problems. It is in use 6 months of the year.  Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: great house watcher
Reviews.Author: stanwill2
Reviews.Content: I have just installed this camera watching the front of my house and shop.  So far it has worked very well.  I will most liely get one more to watch out hunting cabin that was broken into on two occasions prior to my getting this camera.  They are easy to conceal and few people look for them.  They watch your property better than the neighbors.

Reviews.Title: great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: Millie Dunn
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my husband as an anniversary present.  Read reviews of lots of cameras and thought this was the best buy.  So far, it's proved its worth.  Have it mounted on the feeder on our property up north and we're seeing deer daily.  It's fun to see what's going on while we're asleep!  Very durable, withstands the weather, and easy to operate.  As always, it arrived promptly and in great shape from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: bushnell 8mp cam
Reviews.Author: Griff
Reviews.Content: Product arrived ok and within time expected. Have had problem setting date for correct date stamp and could not find answer in book. Otherwise seems to work well

Reviews.Title: Good cameras
Reviews.Author: Yooper
Reviews.Content: I have purchased 3 of these cameras. Battery life is awesome. One camera is going into its third year on the same set of batteries. I have owned several other brands of cameras and so far this is the best one I've used. Very easy to setup. Takes very nice night time and day time photos. Some night photos can be blurry if the animal is moving when camera takes the picture. Great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera !
Reviews.Author: Ellen L. Dunlap
Reviews.Content: I reviewed a few cameras before buying and found this camera had the best review.  It deserves every kudos it gets.  It's exterior case is sturdy and durable.  It is easy to open, set and take the s-card out.  The clarity of both the day and night photos is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Raccoon
Reviews.Author: Heath Pfaff "Author"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an older camera that never took very clear pictures.  In a lot of ways I'm really happy with this product.  It takes great quality pictures and video.  My only complaint is that it can really wash out a picture with the intensity of its flash.  I've yet to find a good, always-works, solution to this.Also, this thing needs a feature that yells at raccoons and tells them to stop eating my barn cats food.  Peepers is hungry, damn it.

Reviews.Title: very very good trail cam.
Reviews.Author: papajoe
Reviews.Content: I have 4 other trail cams that can't even hold a candle to this one. The batt. life is great and the cam. is very compact. Would recmond this to my friends

Reviews.Title: color vs black and white monitor
Reviews.Author: kenneth w. barnard
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures both night and day. But I did not realize you can not observe pictures using the camera's screen unless you opt for the color monitor.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased with Performance
Reviews.Author: brooklou
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera now for about 3 months and am very pleased with its performance. I am only using the camera feature so far so I cannot comment on the video, or field scan features. The daytime pictures are of very good quality and the infrared pictures are clear as well. Have had no problems with the operation of the camera and would highly recommend it to others looking for a small lightweight camera that takes quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Lots of fun!
Reviews.Author: J & M ELECTRICAL "SIMPLY THE BEST"
Reviews.Content: I have had it for a week and, it works very good . We all have fun putting food out for the birds, and other small animals. The size and quality of the camera is good. The picture quality is very good. Thinking about getting a second one.

Reviews.Title: Not a sure thing
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my hunter boyfriend for Christmas.  He loved it, but when he put it up it wasn't working right.  It would "decide" not to take pictures some days and would take them others.  I was very disappointed, because of the price.  The upside was that the company did repair the camera at no extra cost to us, other than shipping it to the company.  It does take great pictures, when it was working correctly.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Hatts2002
Reviews.Content: I have two of these camera's and am looking to buy two more. I absolutely love this camera. I have the 8 Megapixel cameras but only use them on 5 Megapixel. the battery life is amazing. both of the cameras have been out for two years now and I just replaced the batteries about Four months ago. works great in both Hot and Cold temperatures. Have not had any trouble at all with this product. for the price it is well worth the money. compares to the higher end cameras in my opinion. I would recommed using this product with the security box and python locking system. All and all an awesome product.

Reviews.Title: Very Good!
Reviews.Author: Kristina A Walters
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of these cameras. They take great day pics but the night pics are blurry if the animal is moving. trigger speed is good as many of the animals are centered in the pics. Battery life is great as well. I have 3 stealth cams and these are far superior. I get pics of the smaller animals that the stealth cams were ignoring. These cameras have good range im picking up deer and atv riders at around 15 - 20 yards. I recomend for the price.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam Brown Night Vision Trail Camera
Reviews.Author: KB "sunshine"
Reviews.Content: First Trail Camera to purchase.  Easy to use and takes great photos both day and night.  Well worth the money for me, but I am a watcher and not a hunter. Strap is large enough to go around an old tree where the camera is mounted.  The camera has only endured one small snow fall, but no problems so far.

Reviews.Title: Trail Cam
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Its compact size and light weight make this Cam very easy to use.  The use of AA batteries is cost effective vice using several "D" cells in another Trail Cam I own.  If given a choice between the two, this Bushnell Cam wins hands down.....

Reviews.Title: well worth the price
Reviews.Author: dcg
Reviews.Content: I've been using trail cameras for more than 20 years...this is easily the best camera for the price. Battery life alone will blow away the competition. I did have problems with one of my two cameras after one year of use and I sent it back. It was replaced no questions asked and no fee...try that with the expensive Cuddeback! Easily thousands of pictures or videos with one set of Engergizer lithium batteries. One bit of advice...if you have bears in the area, buy a bear box. Neither the plastic nor the strap will stand up to a bear.

Reviews.Title: TROPHY CAM
Reviews.Author: David A. Groebl
Reviews.Content: The camera is a FANTASTIC piece of equipment!  I had some difficulty with the instructions, deciphering the cryptic displays on the camera's display window, and learning how to navigate through the menus, but after reading some sections of the instructions five or six times, it occurred to me what they were talking about.  I'm only half joking, probably just two or three readings did the trick.  I had some questions that were not addressed in the instructions and called the help line a few times.  Those guys are VERY NICE AND VERY HELPFUL.  I can now program the camera easily.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Adam L. Rogers
Reviews.Content: Im a college conservation student so I use these for research and wildlife observation. Here is my experience thus far:Batteries: Runs on AA's (4 or 8)which is great for using cheaper rechargeable batteries!Pictures: clear, fairly crisp images day and night. powerful flash so be sure to bait or aim to observe species at a distance over 10 ft as stated in manual.Trigger: Takes a photo as fast as 1 sec with a minimum 1 sec delay. Settings go higher but with the huge card size it accepts its not an issue. *gb card will get you 7500 images on 8mp resolution and over an hour of video. Trigger sensitivity detects small critters like mice as well.Cool features:  Field scan is very awesome. One thing I did not know til purchase was that the trigger is still active during field scan. This means that if any critter walks in the detection zone between the one minute intervals (minimum) you get a photo.  Audio with video is nice!Overall: a great tiny (open palm sized) camera packed with big camera flavor. I would like to see a flash version in the future but for now I use the Covert Reveal Flash (also on amazon). The trigger speed is on the lower side of the spectrum in trail cam world. If you want faster triggers you have to pay more for the reconyx or cuddeback attack, though proper angles and deployment can overcome short organism exposure to the trigger. Also remember for the price of the faster cams you can have more of these meaning more coverage vs faster triggers. In the end its personal preference and budget.  I will add one of many images captured during a swamp and woodlot wildlife survey.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Greasy Rag "computer wonk"
Reviews.Content: I have experience with cameras costing 3 times as much and there is only one feature I miss: the more expensive (Reconyx) cameras have temperature sensors and appear to take the temperature into account when sensing animals. The Bushnell camera does not do this and must be manually adjusted to account for ambient temperatures. When properly set, a magpie at 20ft will set it off. When improperly set, a tall weed blowing in the wind sets it off, or it does not go off at all. The camera is also a bit slow to take a second picture when set to wait only one second between shots, so I set it to take 3 pictures each time it is activated. With a 2GB chip and the proper setting it can go for weeks (unless you have a particularly active site). Battery life is very good; I have taken over 4,000 shots and the battery indicator reads full (8 lithium batteries).I would give 5 stars for the same camera at $40 more with temperature compensating sensitivity.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Cam
Reviews.Author: S. Frentz
Reviews.Content: I always knew that Bushnell had good optics from the rifle and pistol scopes they make.  It is nice that they carried that optics quality over to this. I am having so much fun with this camera walking around the woods. In just a month, I have seen really cool critters at night, and the next door neighbors' chickens. Also, lots of pictures of me doing yard work. My neighbor caught a mountain lion on his last spring. If you live in a place with wildlife, you should get one of these cameras, too! It so far is working exactly as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Best in it;s class.
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Poteet "Rockdweller"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple weeks and using it around the house just experimenting.  I'm sure I will be totatly satisfied with it as a game camera.  The flash distance, ir distance, detection area and viewing area are as perfect as I would want.  I will use it for small areas and anything more sensitive I'm afraid would have too many false alerts.  I guess a more sensitive camera would be better in open fields but for wooded areas I don't think you could beat this camera at any price.  So far my rechargable batteries are holding up just fine.  I'm not one for giving detailed performance but I don't see why anyone wouldn't be satisfied with this product.  And you can't beat Amazon no matter how you try!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: teacher7-12
Reviews.Content: My husband has two Cuddeback Cameras, and I convinced him to buy this camera recently after reading the reviews. He is very pleased with the performance and price of this camera. The picture quality is great and the number of pictures that he is able to capture is excellent in comparison to the Cuddebacks that he has for they use a maximum of a 1 GB Compact Flash card (which are impossible to find in stores).

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: kb
Reviews.Content: this camera does what is says... had no problems.... easy setup and operationsjust make sure to have good batteries...... had coon, deer, turkey all over the last month

Reviews.Title: DC power and rechargeable batteries don't work
Reviews.Author: K. Carnahan "AnnieMae"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: Bushnell is sending me a replacement for my 119467, which is their updated model 119477c. Although I will lose 8 of the 40 leds and will also lose the widescreen capability, Mike at Bushnell Tech Service says that the 119477c is a much better camera than the 119467. Mike said that the camera isn't really designed to use a DC adapter, that most people who want a plug-in power source use a 6 volt rechargeable adapter, powered by a solar panel; he said that these are available at Cabela's retail store but not online. I recommend that no-one should buy the old 119467 model.ORIGINAL POST:  Bushnell represents that the camera powers optionally with DC power. When you call them up they say that providing the DC power out port is the extent of their responsibility; that they don't supply the DC power adapter. However, they don't spec a DC power adapter in the owner's manual, but rather a *connector* only, not an adapter at all; and the connector they spec has to be soldered onto an adapter! I tried to get a Radio Shack adapter, but to get the 6 volts and the B plug, you have to get their switchable adapter, which only has plugs which have a 90 degree turn in them -- they don't work in the port on the camera because you have to have a straight-in plug. Prefer rechargeable batteries? They won't work either, according to Bushnell's online FAQ! Get ready to use tons of AA batteries, as there is no "real" DC power supply or rechargeable battery option available.  I'm going through 12 batteries every 3 months.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have purchased to date...
Reviews.Author: Jo40788
Reviews.Content: Put this camera out for the first time on Dec 18th and just went to pick it up. The camera lasted about a month in NY with temps on some nights down to 0 degrees. I put in Lithium batteries to make sure it would last through the cold weather. So today, I checked the camera and it had 370 pics with deer almost in every pic! It did have some false pics due to some long hanging branches and bad weather and the batteries were still almost at full charge! So far I am very impressed with the quality of this product. Would highly recommend lithium batteries! You can probably make it through the season with one set of $10 batteries. Night time pics are not the greatest but they will do for something that is IR and does not miss any movement! Even caught a squirrel!

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trail Cams Unreliable times Two
Reviews.Author: J. Staudacher
Reviews.Content: I have two Bushnell trail cameras and I cannot in good faith, recommend them to others.  When they work, they work very well but in the two years I have had my two cameras I have not had a time when one of them was not down for repairs, sometimes BOTH.  I don't know why but the quality of these things seems WAY below the price.Not just Bushnell, I have a Moultrie I40 that has never worked from day one.  Now it's out of warranty and I am out of luck.The trouble I have with the Bushnell's seem to be poor hardware/software interface.  I was skeptical right away when I first saw the cheap three-way switch inside the camera and I was right.  It is very sloppy and often slips past the point you want it into another setting.  I have had all sorts of trouble with the cheap pushbuttons that are supposed to control the menu.  Perhaps they do or maybe the switches are bad or perhaps the software is poor.  No way for me to tell or for me to fix it.  Even while these cameras are in warranty it costs me money for shipping and handling to return them under "Warranty".The battery life is very good however it doesn't do any good when the camera itself is totally unreliable.  It sure does take good pictures and you better enjoy the one you get because you probably won't get many more before it breaks and you have to spend $$ to get it serviced.Once that is done you hop back on the bandwagon . . .a few more pictures (maybe) and it's back for more costly repairs.Bushnell Trail Cam?  No thank you.

Reviews.Title: Blurry photos in low light (bad for research in forests)
Reviews.Author: hot sauce addict
Reviews.Content: I used 60 of these cameras for a year in Sumatran rainforests. Probably nobody knows more about these cameras than me, even Bushnell themselves, as they've told me when I contact them about problems.Main issue:Animals are blurry in daytime photos in low light (e.g. if there's a forest canopy), even if they're moving slowly. This inhibited our ability to identify tiger individuals because you have to see their stripe pattern. It also makes photos rarely suitable for media use, or showing off to your friends.The nighttime photos had the same problem, burry if the animal is moving at all.Both these problems are due to slow shutter speed. Their new cameras have an options for faster shutter speeds at night, but this of course then leads to darker photos, since you're letting in less light to the sensor. HOWEVER, dark day and night photos can be easily brought back to life in Photoshop or another (cheaper) photo editing program. And the end result is better because you have a clear animal.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Martha Andras
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  Very well made.  Takes great pictures of the wildlife in our area.  Happy to have made the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Jayson
Reviews.Content: Purchased this trail camera for driveway security.  The picture quality and motion range is mediocre.  Prior to buying this camera I borrowed a friends much less expensive camera.  Although this camera is smaller, the picture quality and range is no better than the cheaper camera.

Reviews.Title: Battery issues
Reviews.Author: Shane Brewer
Reviews.Content: Pics are nice and battery life is good.  Biggest downfall is the batteries pop out sometimes and at random.  The issues caused from tis are no pics taken and having to reset the time and date all the time.

Reviews.Title: Takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how long the batteries last, 9 months and counting on this set.  Takes great daytime pictures, the night pics are good enough to see what's out there.

Reviews.Title: Not quite there
Reviews.Author: Woody Young
Reviews.Content: Daytime videos are just fine, but the IR coverage at night is lacking. Beyond 20 feet, there is nothing but darkness and the occasional pair of glowing eyes.

Reviews.Title: easy to hide and pics are awesome.
Reviews.Author: liz 22 nd
Reviews.Content: hubby got this for security, but is having trouble viewing the pics.  they don't load from his Kodak camera like the other trail cam does.  Be aware you need to have a sd card to use this cam.  as  it has NO internal memory

Reviews.Title: Fun!!
Reviews.Author: Barry D. Boney "Barry D Boney"
Reviews.Content: No problems , takes good pics easy to program , batteries last in camera mode if set so it doesn't take continuously. need to buy extra SD cards so you can change it out without removing camera. I recommend it, there are cameras with more features but this is a good basic camera!

Reviews.Title: Takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: John Ingle
Reviews.Content: Took 584 pics first week, some of which were quite clear. Good battery life. Strap is cheap as is the buckle.

Reviews.Title: Great cam!
Reviews.Author: Melissa J. Hertneky "blondieboo"
Reviews.Content: This cam has been so fun! We enjoy checking it to see what little critters are visiting our backyard at night.

Reviews.Title: Rats convicted
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Konrad
Reviews.Content: I used this camera to determine who had eaten the bark from our lemon tree. The peels of lemons had also been eaten. I claimed rats did it, my wife said I was crazy.Set up the camera and recorded over night. Set to take an image every 15 min, and when triggered by movement.The rats were too small to trigger the camera, and when I first looked at the individual timed images I couldn't see anything. Then I used QuickTime to link the individual images together to make a video; then we could clearly see the rats climb the tree and eat bark.The camera didn't tell me what to do about the rats, but it isn't its job.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Joe harrison
Reviews.Content: i have used other brands of trail cameras but this one is much nicer in features and ease of setup....quality of pictures day and night are superior to the others i have used....you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: A gift.
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L Parker
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present and they are very happy with it. Pictures are much better than their previous camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: C. Pina "cap"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to capture the wildlife around my house, after a little over a month of use it's been working great and captured several animals at various times of day and night. It's very easy to use and set up and the compact size is perfect for placement on trees. It also blends in fairly well when mounted onto a tree. I like the time stamp feature, life of batteries, and ease of downloading the photos. The quality of the photos is also very nice even set at the 5MP setting, night photos are good and clear as long as the animals are standing pretty still. I also like the fact that it is fairly water resistant, we've had some serious rain/wind here and water has not penetrated the case, temperatures have also dipped below 20F and it's held up with no issues.My one complaint is that there is nothing holding the batteries in place so that if you close the camera up, get ready to mount it and then handle it a bit too rough the batteries can pop out of place and now you have a non-operating camera which also clears the time/date setting. After this happens you have to reset the time/date and re-mount your camera. A bit of foam can fix this but I have yet to implement my proposed fix. Otherwise it's a great little camera, a bit on the pricey side but worth it.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money
Reviews.Author: Daya
Reviews.Content: The simplicity of this camera made my husband love it and the ability to swap out memory cards and the clarity of the pictures it takes made me love it. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Spy on bears, deer, bobcats and raccoons
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Secures the camera at our hunting club well.  Videos are excellent and watching the animals is priceless. Helps my husband know his camera is secure.

Reviews.Title: Like/dislike
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: There is much to like about the 8MP Trophy Cam.  It is sturdy, easy to operate and takes great photos and video.  But I dislike the fact that I must view the contents of the memory card on another device.  Also, there is a longer lapse of time than I expected from the point at which the motion sensor is triggered and the photographing begins.  Last, I am often annoyed by the difficulty of opening and closing the cover.  The fastening mechanism is quite functional but not user friendly.

Reviews.Title: As good as my others
Reviews.Author: R. C. Rudder, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I have two Moultrie game cameras. This one is just as good. I did notice that the instructions required the camera to be turned off prior to removing the SD card. The others do not. Battery life is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Super game cam
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Dave Como"
Reviews.Content: We have owned at least half a dozen of the Bushnell 8mp Trpohy Cams. We've also owned several other brands. The Bushnell has had superior battery life compared to all the others we've used. It's also lightweight, easy to set up, takes good photos and pricing is great. So why only a rating of 4 stars you ask? The photos often only catch game pics as the animal is leaving the frame or aren't in the frame at all. The camera seems to trigger at the wrong moment and not pick up the subject at the beginning of the frame all of the time. The best thing we've accomplished with this camera is catching two burglars breaking into our camp! We were able to have them ID'd by their vehicle license number that showed clearly. One has been apprehended and is now awaiting sentencing.  I highly recommend using the camera to protect your remote camp.

Reviews.Title: Very Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 2.5 years ago and have been more or less very happy with it. This is also not the first trail camera that I have owned and currently own two others (another one of these bushnells and a bone collector hd). This camera does all that it says that it will do, but you do have to have some common sense. For example, don't point it directly east or west or all of your dawn and dusk photos will be dark (which is a major issue if you are using this camera for primarily deer as I do).In the 2.5 years that I have owned and been actively using this camera I have only changed the batteries twice. The first time was after 6 months because it kept taking photos of the wind moving brush (sensitivity was too high). And the second time was about a year ago. I keep my cameras out year round, which means that the second set of 8 batteries lasted an incredible 18 months or so.I bought this camera primarily for the hd video and 8mp photos. I have not been disappointed. Lots of people tend to leave negative feedback about trail cameras when they get pictures that are blurry. This happens when the animal moves right as the shutter goes off, just the same with any other camera. The video has always been flawless for me and very helpful in deciding when to hunt or not hunt an area.The only reason that I did not rate this 5 stars is because occasionally (and I don't know why) when I check the cam after having it out for 2-3 weeks it will have 2-4 days randomly missing like it just skipped those days. It is usually during the nighttime hours. I have not called bushnell on this yet. This occurs probably around 5-10% of the time that I leave it out for multiple weeks.

Reviews.Title: Very nice Trail Camera
Reviews.Author: Ron Horn
Reviews.Content: I have 2 trail camera's just like this and found this one at an incredible price on Amazon, I love the ease and comfort from ordering online. I have suggested to all my hunting friends that they should also try this trail cam.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Jkozi
Reviews.Content: The first camera I got had some broken plastic but Amazon took care of it at no charge and sent me a new one in mail, UPS even came right up to my door to return it.  It takes very nice pictures and works at low temperatures if the batteries can handle it.  No problems yet.I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Best cameras
Reviews.Author: Nathan McEntire
Reviews.Content: Great product I have had this same type of camera already for 3 years and have not had a issue one takes great night time and daytime photosI've tried a lot of other cameras and have had problems but not this brand bushnell is the best in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Russell Zingelman
Reviews.Content: Somewhat complicated to set up.  Instruction manual print too small.  Camera needs four mounting strap holes instead of only two.Finger latches are difficult to release.  Does take good pictures, but sensing range is limited.OK for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: mollysdad
Reviews.Content: I have three now. Not always perfect but good for the money and has a 2 year warranty. Easy to program and tough to beat with the lock box and python cable.

Reviews.Title: I can't figure out how to use the Scouting Assistant program
Reviews.Author: Avid West Granby Reader
Reviews.Content: It's frustrating that I can't download and view the images from my camera to the Trophy Cam's computer program.  It shoudl be a simple task, but for me it isn't.  The instructions haven't -- so far -- been helpful, but I'll keep trying.

Reviews.Title: worked as expected.
Reviews.Author: Lloyd Barber
Reviews.Content: It doesn't give the best night time photos, but still works great and I found out when the deer were out.  I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Corinne Francis
Reviews.Content: Bought as a gift for my husband and son and they both really love it.  It takes good pictures and is easy to use.  I thought it was a good price for a mid level trail cam.

Reviews.Title: Fun and sturdy product
Reviews.Author: Vicki E Burns
Reviews.Content: The only negative is that on very windy days, the sensor will trigger so need to avoid pointing at branches.  Also, the camera can catch movement well past the advertised footage as we pointed across yard towards street and got pictures of all cars on street.  Easy to operate and retrieve photos.

Reviews.Title: Overall good quality product
Reviews.Author: J. C. Mazoch
Reviews.Content: I purchased several units an out of them I had 1 failure due to a defective switch. I am currently in the process of getting the unit replaced.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Boyd Jeremiah Pierce
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the Trophy Cam. We are not hunters. We feed the deer in our back yard and have had 7 or more eating at one time, several times. It does everything that it was advertised to do. jp

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: excellent camera, easy to set up. great pictures day and night. I would recommend  it to any one looking for a easy to use camera with great pictures

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Lori Kaminski
Reviews.Content: Had one just like it and really liked its performance and quality. The price was right and made a great gift.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price - Careful on Updates
Reviews.Author: Zeek
Reviews.Content: I bought this in 2011 for security reasons after and acquaintance had a burglary of his home which was ultimately solved due to his Trophy Cam capturing the car the fecal orifices were driving.  I bought the power cord and 32GB  card if you want to use it long term with the highest video settings.  ***Beware of doing a software update to your camera if your camera is working fine.  I updated from the Bushnell website and it rendered mine useless.  Mine started taking continuous pictures with random dates non-stop until it killed the batteries****  Initially I emailed Bushnell and they gave me some canned reply about sending it back for an evaluation which pissed me off because that is a waste of my time and money.  Soooo  . . . I called them, stayed on hold for 15 minutes and nicely expressed my disappointment with their product and service.  The very nice man on the other end promptly sent me a replacement camera at no charge.  I would recommend the product and company.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: James R. Davis IV
Reviews.Content: First season with this cam.  Takes good pictures - day, decent pictures at night.  Trigger fast enough, doesn't miss the shot often.Battery life excellent.Second season for a older model, and it takes good pictures also.  Date/Time stamp on it is defective now, but otherwise working great & good battery life also.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: reviewit
Reviews.Content: I leave this cam in the woods running in 30 second video mode for months at a time and have never replaced the batteries and it's been close to a year.  The night vision works well and captures a lot of movement.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: could sell the recommended unit as less costs
Reviews.Author: StanMobile1
Reviews.Content: I received the Bushnell Trophy Cam (Camo) as a Christmas present in 2012,  During this period the camera functioned quite well in both photo stills and video.  During a recent hunting trip the camera gave up the ghost and quite functioning.  Setup screen was dead.  I contacted Bushnell customer service for repair and/or replacement and found out that if I didn't have the original receipt the date they would use for figuring warranty period was the date of manufacture. I again noted that I had received this as a present.  The serial number indicated that this unit was manufactured over two years ago, and was considered outside the warranty period.  Bushnell also indicated that if I sent the unit in for repair, it would most probably exceed the cost of a new unit.  Of course they gave me the option of buying a new camera at their supposed reduced price.  After my frustrating discussion I went on line and found that Cabelas and a few other sports stores, could sell the recommended unit as less costs.  All I have now is a spendy paperweight.  This is the short version of the discussion.The camera is good, but the 'customer service' sucks!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great product, great photo quality!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Francisco "Sarah"
Reviews.Content: I bought one for my dad and one for my husband last year as Christmas presents.  They've both had great luck for almost a year now.  The photo quality is crisp and very impressive!  The first time we put ours out, we didn't realize how far away the motion would trigger it.  We have 13 acres and put in on a tree at the edge of our property pointing toward our house and the road was beyond - maybe 7 acres from the road.  We had a bunch of photos of cars, a school bus, a police car... a raccoon at night, cars...a rabbit...  it was hysterically funny!

Reviews.Title: Dependable Easy Operation
Reviews.Author: Dennis E. Nail
Reviews.Content: First trail cam but not my first Bushnell product.  I didn't realize the viewer for any photos taken was not with this unit. I read the manual over and over and finally it dawned on me there was NO VIEWING SCREEN FOR PHOTOS TAKEN. I take the unit inside for photo review. I have dropped the unit a few times and it still preforms. Takes good photos. Easy to operate and everything outside of batteries and memory card was included.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: ZD "ZD"
Reviews.Content: Works really well, I've gotten all kinds of videos of everything from deer and elk to bear and all the way down to rat, skunks, and possums. Still on my original batteries after 4 months.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Remote Trail/Game Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Carlson "RJC"
Reviews.Content: Great trail/game camera.  Tremendous daytime color pics using the 8 MP resolution; good quality B&W; night pics using the IR flash.  I have had excellent results when using this camera for game population analysis.  Performs well in sub-zero and wet weather.  I leave the camera in place for 2 weeks at a time and usually get 200-300 pics with the auto-shoot set to 3 pics per activation.  Using a 32 gig SD card I have never had a problem with storage.  I recommend getting the "bear box" and security cable to insure that your camera will still be where you left it.

Reviews.Title: great camers
Reviews.Author: hammer
Reviews.Content: this is the best for the money I have several other cameras but this is the best i have found for a all around camera It takes great day and night pics The pics are just as good as the $400 cameras i have and the battery life is allot better.I have over 13000 pictures on the first one on the first set of battery's over a two years ive had it. I Cant help with the video because i have not tried it yet.

Reviews.Title: Batteries Come Loose When I Close It Up
Reviews.Author: J. pulfer
Reviews.Content: The camera has a problem where the batteries seem to loose contact just as you close it up and turn it on. Its very difficult from that point on to tell if the darn thing is on or off.  A little red light on th outside flashes a few times, but that has not turned out to be a good predictor of when it is going to work or when it stops working just as I slide it into the case that holds it in place.Quite a few times I've gone off and come back to discover that it never came on and as a result there are no photos! Ive solved the problem by folding up a sheet of paper and laying it accross the batteries when I close up the case, that seems to fill just enough space to keep the batteries in place.  Not the end of the world, but you'd think they could make the case so I wouldn't have to do this! Otherwise its not too difficult to setup and the pictures are nice.

Reviews.Title: One year and 3 months and still the same batteries
Reviews.Author: J-DUB
Reviews.Content: Over a year of photos and still on the same set of batteries.  In the Colorado crazy variable weather conditions, we have had this thing out in the woods for over a year and 3 months.  Captured pictures of Elk, Bear, Deer, Bobcat, Fox, Coyote, etc.  We also have a trail cam that takes 8 C batteries.  In one winter we had to replace them 3 separate times.  I would recommend having the picture setting on 8MP and to take pictures every few seconds.  With elk walking by, it will get its head, then the butt.  So keep the time low between the photos.  Never used the video so I cant comment on that.

Reviews.Title: A fun camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce Harper
Reviews.Content: Works great, but manual is a little confusing. I have captured videos and photos of birds, mountain lions, bob cats, fox, deer, etc. Both day and night

Reviews.Title: Excellent Investment
Reviews.Author: chhumli
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent investment! First trail camera own, and I love it. Maybe there are better cameras out there, but I was not disappointed with my selection.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Summers Acres
Reviews.Content: This camera is all it claims to be. I love it. For more details and examples of the photos and videos it takes visit our full review at:[...]

Reviews.Title: review of trail cam
Reviews.Author: Jordy Tisdale
Reviews.Content: Just what the doctor ordered. Not all the cachets but gives me clear pictures. I fI could change one thing it would be the distance of the flash at night. It will see movement at 50 or 60 ft. but will not pick it up with the flash. I owned 2 of these cameras and yes I would recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for watching animals and humans as well
Reviews.Author: Angie Foil
Reviews.Content: Had a break in at our home so decided to put this out to record anyone coming and going. Worked great and will keep it to watch the traffic in and out of our home.

Reviews.Title: 8MP Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: John F Kretschmann
Reviews.Content: After comparing various brands/models, I decided on this unit.  It does everything I need it to do and does it with minimum fuss.  I consider the price reasonable.  Would recommend to others looking for a quality camera with useable features.

Reviews.Title: This will get you pictures...
Reviews.Author: Curtis L. Benton "Jeweler in disguise"
Reviews.Content: Although setting this up takes a couple of tries, once you read and understand the directions, it comes up online and then gives you pictures that you don't expect.  Color pictures for daytime shooting and black and white pictures for night shots gets your job done with inconspicuous efficiency.

Reviews.Title: great trophy cam
Reviews.Author: richard woodgeard
Reviews.Content: I use this trophy cam to watch over our house while we are gone as well as checking out the wildlife out back.

Reviews.Title: Triggering is a Bit Slow - as Objects are Gone !
Reviews.Author: Kathy Lawrence
Reviews.Content: Needs to have Faster Trigger , I have New Batteries and Fastest Memory they make I have also Stepped down tothe Lower settings - Nothing seems to Pick Up the Trigger Speed . This is the Base Model , so Hoping the Latest Modelsare Faster in that Area . Example : Persons walking Normal to Slow is picks up half way across  the Viewing Area ..Persons walking Fast or jogging - are Gone = ( False Trigger ) so they call it  , what it really is _ too Dam Slow .16 Gigs Card is  good for 3-4 Days  or 490-599 Triggers - which is a lot - I have It located in - Busy  Area !File size at night is 6K and Day time is 10K with Sound ON ..Video Quality is V. Good out to 66 ft at Night or more If have street lights .

Reviews.Title: overall good
Reviews.Author: D. Zydel
Reviews.Content: A little tricky to set it up. Takes great, clear pics. batteries seem to be holding up well. activates quickly.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Karen Jordan
Reviews.Content: This was a gift.  The recipient could not have been more pleased with it.  He has been able to get clear and exceptional photographs of wildlife in their natural habitat through the use of this fine equipment.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my dad and he loves it. it takes pretty good pictures at night and better pictures during the day. He is still trying to get the hang of the thing but he's not exactly tech. savvy.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ndmcsx
Reviews.Content: We have 8 of these.  For the money,  you can't beat them. The only problem we've had is one of the screens went blank after a couple years. I'm guessing a loose wire because it started working again.  I think I'm gonna buy a couple more of these.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are great!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Morris
Reviews.Content: Daytime pictures are beautiful-nightime are black and white but you can see all you need to see.  Have had this camera for a year now and no complaints with it-we placed a 32gb card in it so we have never had a problem filling that up-I would recommend getting two smaller sd cards so you can just swap them out when you go to check your camera

Reviews.Title: Husband loves it
Reviews.Author: dlittle1
Reviews.Content: Everything my husband was looking for....great pictures!Hangs nicely on tree and very conveniently sized. Has sound which is a plus!

Reviews.Title: best  value
Reviews.Author: bb454
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money. I get the most deer pictures with this camera. Easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: awesome product
Reviews.Author: fiftycats
Reviews.Content: I use it all the time.  It works great!  I had someone break into my house, and now I plan to set it up to catch the thief.  Cant wait to try that

Reviews.Title: Bushnell camera
Reviews.Author: J. Shirey
Reviews.Content: the pictures are great quality.  It was easy to set up and put in place.  The camera uses 8 AA batteries and they are easily dislodged so the camera's power needs checked often.  I like it now that I know about the batteries.  I recommend this product to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Bargain
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: I have a couple of these cams and this one functions flawlessly as I would expect from a Bushnell product. The real difference here is the price, which is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: davemaj27
Reviews.Content: I have 11 of these cameras and would not purchase any other brand.  This camera has all of the necessary features to give great picture results and the price is hard to beat.  My cameras spend 8 months in the woods every year and continue to work great.  I always recommend the Trophy camera to anyone who ask me what camera I like.Delivery of the camera was very fast.  If you give one a try you will not be unhappy.

Reviews.Title: I now hve 2 of these and two 5MP versions
Reviews.Author: Random
Reviews.Content: good camera's, great battery life, I've 4 trophy cams now, retired my others because they eat batteries. Will be getting more.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for long
Reviews.Author: Pablo Dee "More Info"
Reviews.Content: Item worked the first time i used it....doesn't seem t be working now ....and it seems to really burn the batteries quickly

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: fiacost
Reviews.Content: I have two of this cameras hanging in the woods since 2011 and, I have collected more than 400 pictures from every critter leaving in eastern Canada. Night photos are not crystal clear but, I'm not interested in seeing anything smaller that a rabbit; day time photos are nice and clear.  Since July 2011 I have replaced the batteries 3 times in one camera and 2 in the other one (I always have one of them turned off during the winter). No leaks and no problems with batteries falling from their compartment. I had one of the top batteries getting a little bit loose and all I had to do was to stretch the metal spring on the negative pole and that was it.  If you have no plans to sell your photos to the National Geography magazine and, all you want to do is checking whatever is moving around your home or hunting area, this is the camera you want.....

Reviews.Title: Our first trail camera
Reviews.Author: love2read
Reviews.Content: We set the camera up to review the night traffic to our bird feeders.  It does a great job and has gotten us valuable information.  The next location to set up will give us information on the deer and other animals on our wildlife land.  Thanks for a good product!  We have used Bushnell products before and count on their excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Works like a dream
Reviews.Author: P. Shipman "anthropologist & writer"
Reviews.Content: The camera is really easy to set up and works perfectly. Highly recommended by this photographer and visiting critters alike!

Reviews.Title: Great fun to use
Reviews.Author: Peri's Mom
Reviews.Content: Got this as a gift for my in-laws.  We have captured some fun animals with it.  It takes a very good picture both in day light and night time.  Sometimes the animals move enough to make the picture blurry but it keeps taking pictures as they move and we usually end up with a good shot.  Very user friendly.  I would recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, easy to use
Reviews.Author: G. Morin
Reviews.Content: Takes great photos and easy to use. I've been using it to try and catch a neighbor that is dumping grass clippings on my lawn (haven't caught him yet) but the motion activation works well... I see the lawn service cutting my grass every 2 weeks ;-) Batteries last a long time too, have had one set it in for at least 3 months now. Anyway, does what it says, good quality photos and has given me no problems.
