Reviews.Title: pretty good animal camera
Reviews.Author: Kaleberg "one_kaleberg"
Reviews.Content: It's waterproof, fairly tough and it has all the features you would expect for a device you are likely to tie to a tree (with the included belt), leave in the woods or fields for a few days or a week, and then go grab the memory card (not included). It's battery operated, has a fair set of options, stores lots of photos, uses its IR flash at night and produces images good enough to figure out what is nibbling what in your garden or digging in your flower bed. I suppose hunters might use it for finding game, but we had other problems. It doesn't take the kind of photos you see in the magazines. Those require serious cameras and probably serious rigs, but it is a great, modestly priced camera for taking certain kinds of pictures.(Wow, that was vague. I doubt anyone will find this review useful.)

Reviews.Title: Works great, when it works at all
Reviews.Author: Lukas Mandrake "Think About Something Today"
Reviews.Content: The technology of this item is great, namely the camera. Nice pictures, high res, infrared and color both, and nice sound sensitivity.The battery case, port location, and interface is terrible, however. The battery case permits any one of the eight AA batteries to pop out as you set it in a location, causing the device to seem to function but then fail to take pictures. The location for the power port is underneath the device, preventing it from being propped up in a locale while plugged in. Further, you can't plug the device in, then close the case, as the hole goes through an overlapping section of plastic. The interface frequently forgets the time/date and is about as easy to use as an 80's VCR, i.e. not at all easy.All in all, whoever is making the camera needs to find another company to make the housing. This thing is very hard to use and frequently fails to capture a thing at night, even with experienced use.I regret this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excelent trail cam
Reviews.Author: Henry Alberto Suárez Badillo
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. I've only had a problem with night pics: when the animal detected is very close to the camera the image is blurred. However, I think I should continue reviewing the manual to learn how to fix this.Excellent video.Excelent portability.

Reviews.Title: ok for price
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Jensen
Reviews.Content: not to hard to set up easy to review battery life ok good pictures up close besure of were you point it. Took a littler effort to get right

Reviews.Title: My husband loves it
Reviews.Author: Camille Koivisto
Reviews.Content: My husband really likes the trail cam. He never knows what he might see come through on the trail. THe bears are especially fun to see.

Reviews.Title: great pictures
Reviews.Author: bill jung
Reviews.Content: The pictures are excellent in quality, but what I like best is the quick speed of the timer so that I get pictures of the animals moving through.

Reviews.Title: Great camera?
Reviews.Author: Pat Flansburg
Reviews.Content: Was a gift for my hubby, and he is having a great time with it. The battery life is super and the pictures are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: best camera
Reviews.Author: Lance Larson
Reviews.Content: i have had cuddeback and some other cheap camera but neither compare to Bushnell trophy cam. Battery life is amazing! This is my 4th trophy camera. I have had one for 4years and it is still going strong. Easy to set up and a very durable camera. I will not buy any other brand.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Cynthia D Miller
Reviews.Content: It is surprising what lurks around in your yard at night.  We have seen deer, fox, possum, coyote and I'm not sure what another animal is..... SCARy

Reviews.Title: battery life
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: I have used stealthcam, wildview, and leupold before buying 8 of these. I've used the same ones for years and have probably saved money with the one year battery life

Reviews.Title: Good product for the money
Reviews.Author: Raymond J Barry
Reviews.Content: I have a Bushnell camera already. I just bought 2 more. I also have the high end cameras. The trophy cam is a good value for the money. If you need to gather intelligence on an area it is perfect. Day time photos are crisp and clear. Night time photos are good but can be washed out if the subject gets too close to the camera. If it is information you need this camera will supply it at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: great picture quality
Reviews.Author: ADK doc
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to see how my black Lab was breaking through the gate I'd built to keep him out of the cat food (and the litter boxes - ugh!). It worked great - got some hilarious video and also the information I needed to solve the problem. Looking forward to using it outside to catch some wildlife.My only complaint is, since I'm using it indoors, I wish it could be plugged in.

Reviews.Title: Using it for surveillance
Reviews.Author: Elena Komrosky
Reviews.Content: Used it once so far and it produces good pictures during the day and night.  The light does flash at night while taking a picture so it is detectable, however, if placed in the right spot its still worth purchasing for surveillance.  I especially like the field feature that automatically takes pictures every 1m, 5m or 15 minutes regardless if there is motion or not.  It also does well if placed in a window - however not for night time photos.  I live out in the country and after all the break ins that we have had this gives me peace of mind that I can have an aerial view of my property while my home security system keeps the house safe.  If something does happen this will capture a vehicle, license plate or picture of someone outside the property.  For you hunters, yes there was a deer in the driveway that triggered the motion.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: marius
Reviews.Content: It's a SIMPLE to install, and functions better then I expected. Great product. I HIGHLY RECOMMENT THIS PRODUCT TO ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Be1bob
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my mother to put at her cabin so she can see what animals come by ever week and she loves it. She wants more lol. Have not had any issues with it so far

Reviews.Title: Good Product!!
Reviews.Author: santosh pitla
Reviews.Content: The cameras met my expectations, well built !! For the price these cameras do a great job. Left these in sun and rain outside and  for sure they are weather proof

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Animal Cam
Reviews.Author: Toy Buff
Reviews.Content: Can't live without my Trophy Cam and purchased this one for my son.  Three weeks ago captured pictures of a bear wandering right through my property, just feet from my deck.

Reviews.Title: Takes good photos
Reviews.Author: Bradley Buckmiller
Reviews.Content: I actually use this camera for paranormal investigations. It's not designed for this and so it's not as user frendly as a regular IR camera, but then again it also didn't cost hundreds of dollars. I'm very pleased with the quality of the photos, especially considering what I paid for it. I plan on getting more.

Reviews.Title: Now we know
Reviews.Author: D. Reid Mccrary
Reviews.Content: We can see all the deer and other animals that crisscross our wooded property even while on a coastal vacation

Reviews.Title: Nice Pics
Reviews.Author: Justme
Reviews.Content: This camera meets all our expectations. Takes very good day pictures and pleasantly surprised at the clarity of the night photos.

Reviews.Title: Who is in our woods
Reviews.Author: Grammy Boo
Reviews.Content: Now we know, the camera works great. I had been monitoring squirrel activity and was shocked to see a large black bear face recorded at 5:10 a.m. The day and time stamp feature adds a lot when trying to understand movement cycles.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Peter Watje
Reviews.Content: Dead on arrival.  It wont boot up and just gives the low battery signal regardless of the batteries ( tried 3 different sets to make sure it was not a battery issue).  Sending it back.

Reviews.Title: Hunter in SC
Reviews.Author: John D. Hiers
Reviews.Content: This is my second Trophy Cam and it does a great job taking daytime pictures.  The night range is somewhat limited but does a satisfactory job of taking pictures.  The trigger speed is good and battery life has been excellent with lithium batteries.  The only negative is it has gotten water in it several times during periods of heavy rain and I had to take the batteries out let the inside dry out to keep the contacts from rusting.

Reviews.Title: Might be okay for capturing turtle or possum images, but useless for faster critters
Reviews.Author: Gary Hodge
Reviews.Content: Rather than planning on capturing game activity, I actually bought this for augmenting my security camera system (wanted to fill in some dead camera areas without having to install more wiring)Product description says that this camera has a 1 second trigger time. Not even close - takes at least ten seconds to start capturing images (I timed it) This long trigger delay time makes it useless as a security device, since area lowlifes can do a lot of damage in 10 seconds. Other than that flaw, I suppose that it would be adequate to observe game activity, but I'm not up for killing Bambi, so it's useless to me.Unfortunately, when it seemed to set up ok, I threw the blister packaging away, so I guess I'll have to eat the $125 that I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Cam
Reviews.Author: William Russell
Reviews.Content: Now this cam works like it should... going to get others... You need a hard case to keep anyone or anything to from taken it.

Reviews.Title: Husband love it!
Reviews.Author: Maureen Kotula
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband for his birthday and he loved it, meet all his expectations.  He hasn't had a problem with it and it takes good pics.

Reviews.Title: It's worked great.
Reviews.Author: tiger
Reviews.Content: When I opened the package I was prepared for trouble and some very complicated instructions. Not so! It's easy to set up and took just a few minutes. I would still need to have the instructions along to change settings but then again, I'm a dope.  I have set it how I like it and now I simply turn it on and hang it on a tree. Later, I take it down and switch it off to remove the SD card. Simple! The photo quality is very good in daylight. 8MP looks bright and sharp to me. I can see whiskers at several yards. At night, (black and white) the quality is lower and it can get a little fuzzy with flash reflection from the target if the target is close. The red night flash is very discrete.  The trigger is plenty fast enough for any wildlife I want to photograph at any distance I require. It functioned perfectly in bitter cold, wet snow and in the blazing sun. I love the field scan mode. Careful, that means LOTS of photos. I now understand how nice a built in laser pointer aiming device would be. Oh well, I just practice a bit, double check and aim it carefully.  To look at photos in the field I bring an Ipad and a small apple SD adapter for the chip. If I had a smart phone it would be even more slick though I like the large images on the Ipad. I have not yet used the video capabilities.  Just a few years ago a camera of this quality was just too expensive.  I plan on getting a couple more of these very nice, very entertaining and reasonably priced cameras.

Reviews.Title: Solid Performace
Reviews.Author: D. Boyd "D Boyd"
Reviews.Content: Have used it  to capture the critters running around in the yard for about a year. Deer do notice the LEDs coming on but are not spooked - if anything they are curious enough that I have had to clean deer slobber from the lens a few times. It is sparing on the batteries. Only had to replace once over the year. The user controls are a bit weird to operate but are better than the others I have used in the past. Very few false triggers.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!!
Reviews.Author: Ralph Conte
Reviews.Content: It does everything I had hoped for and more.  I would highly recommend it to other people if they have a need for them asI did. ............

Reviews.Title: Instructions Suck!!
Reviews.Author: Fred Hatrem
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pictures and videos. However, good-luck with using the instruction booklet. Not only are the instructions ambiguous, they are simply wrong.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bloodshed
Reviews.Content: It got 154 pics of the 450 lb bear that has been hanging around my vacation home in Florida the first night. Not the best infrared pics i've seen but you could tell it was a boar at 35 ft. Will pick up deer horns in Wi, no problem.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam Camera
Reviews.Author: Marcia Watts "workaholic book reader"
Reviews.Content: The camera has worked really well so far.  No problems with the camera and the batteries are still working well and they are only energizer batteries.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Thomas Burge
Reviews.Content: Daytime pictures are great.  Night time are ok, blurry if deer are moving.  Range is very good both day and night

Reviews.Title: Great Trail Cam Untill It Was Stolen
Reviews.Author: AnimalsRule
Reviews.Content: This was my first trail camera and i was completely pleased with it while i had it, over a year.  Long battery life, great picture quality, blends in with the surroundings.ConsI had purchased the master lock python steel cable to lock it to a tree. The cable couldnt be cut with the theifs machete after multiple attempts, but the cheap plastic parts that are on the back of the camera were not close to strong. the camera was stolen leaving behind my cable.

Reviews.Title: Daily entertainment
Reviews.Author: R. Meling "Habitat guy"
Reviews.Content: We live adjacent to a national park in southern Arizona, amidst a variety of wildlife.  After a neighbor showed a video of his animal visitors, I decided to get the Bushnell.I pondered pretty heavily which Bushnell to purchase.  The main issue for me was whether to purchase the model with the blacked-out infrared flash.  Some folks mentioned the blacked-out flash was less distracting to the critters.  I decided to go the cheap route and got this one instead.  I can attest that the infrared flash is barely noticeable, and that the critters don't seem to mind at all.We strapped the unit to the trunk of a tree adjacent to a watering trough in our front yard.  It's about ten feet from the house to the water.It's almost the high point of our day when we pull the SD memory card from the unit each day, plug it into the laptop, and look to see who visited in the previous 24 hours!  The daytime pictures are great, with good resolution and colors.  The night-time pictures are still good, but black and white.  The best critters come at night.Set-up of the unit was very easy.  It's also very weather tight.  My only objection thus far is that from the time you turn the unit ON, you only have 10 seconds before it starts taking pictures.  It's hard to close the two snaps on the cover in that short period.The flash carries much further than I would have guessed.  In my case, the unit is just a few feet from the water, so there is plenty of light.  I'd prefer to put the Bushnell a bit further away, but lack a sturdy tree at the optimal distance.I put a 32gb SD card in it, reasoning that I'm sometimes gone for weeks.  I recently returned from a 6 week trip to find over 3500 pictures. I had set the unit to take 3 pictures each time motion is detected.  After eliminating lots of bird and ground squirrel pictures, I found some great pictures of deer, javalina, coyotes, and bobcats.A friend purchased a less expensive unit from a different manufacturer.  It is MUCH larger.  I really prefer this smaller unit, as it is less visible.I would certainly purchase this unit again, and would recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: M. Moore "Melymell"
Reviews.Content: Helped my coworker find his cat!  Great night vision, but the battery died in the middle of the night.  Good camera

Reviews.Title: trail cam
Reviews.Author: scottrace1
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. I've had it out for five months and still have the same cheap batteries in it. Great camera , don't think you would be disappointed with it. You'll save a fortune on batteries...

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: lauren
Reviews.Content: Excellent condition when it came in the mail. Came in on time and the product looked just like it would if you bought it at the store. I would reccoment this to any hunter in need of a basic but trust worthly trail camera.

Reviews.Title: so far happy with item
Reviews.Author: Patricia Corrow "Patti"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this  cam for my husband for Christmas.  He is not a hunter but does enjoy the wild life around our home. we are both enoying the cam and we look forward to seeing what  pictures the cam has taken.I giving this a 4 star because so far we are happy with this item.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures
Reviews.Author: jhenningsen
Reviews.Content: This Bushnell takes wonderful clear pictures.  The day one are vibrant and the night are very clear also!  Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Best Ever!
Reviews.Author: diane
Reviews.Content: This is our second Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam purchase!  The pictures are clear no matter what the weather or time of day or night.It takes great videos!We would HIGHLY recommend this trail cam to anyone wanting to what animals visit your area.

Reviews.Title: Works well, battery life is great.
Reviews.Author: John Crawford
Reviews.Content: I used three of these game cameras in the Sierra's this summer and caught countless animals at day and night.  I was especially impressed with the battery life and night-time photographs.  The set-up is fairly straight forward, and the LCD screen is a huge help.The only area where I think Bushnell could improve is on the night-flash.  While it illuminates the field of view well, it is just slightly visible to the naked human eye.  Some animals also appeared to look over at it in the 2nd or 3rd photo.  Thankfully, this light wasn't noticeable enough to cause the cameras to get stolen, but if you plan to use it on a well-hiked trail or in an urban environment, this could be a problem.

Reviews.Title: MY THIRD ONE IVE PURCHASED! BEATS MY MOULTRIE AND WILDGAME CAMERAS
Reviews.Author: Jason Bailey
Reviews.Content: I OWN 8 GAME CAMERAS, 3 MOULTRIE BRAND AND TWO WILDGAME CAMERAS AND 3 BUSHNELL CAMERAS.  I TESTED MY NEW MOULTRIE MINI CAMERA AGAINST THIS BUSHNELL AND THE MOULTRIE HARDER ON BATTERY LIFE EVEN THOUGH THE THE BUSHNELL HAS A HIGHER RESOLUTION. THE SAME TYPE AND NUMBER OF AA BATTERIES LAST WELL OVER 10,000 PICTURES IN MY BUSHNELL AS OPPOSED TO THE 3000-4000 PICTURES ON THE MOULTRIE.  BOTTOM LINE, MOULTRIE ISNT JUNK BUT THE BUSHNELL IS TOP OF THE LINE CAMERA IN MY CAMERA ARSENAL.  YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR WHEN IT COMES TO THESE CAMERAS

Reviews.Title: work great
Reviews.Author: wayne
Reviews.Content: take good videos work great for my needs, work great in the rain, wish it was made in usa so far so good ,hope it last .

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband for Christmas per his request.  He loves it, battery life is awesome compared to his old Moultrie, it fits right in his pocket and the pictures are outstanding.  Great camera for a great price!

Reviews.Title: Gift for husband
Reviews.Author: Louise A Ford
Reviews.Content: Seemed to like it fine, but a little hard to follow the directions.  Timer was not exactly as represented but experimental pictures were good.

Reviews.Title: Outdoor Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Whitecotten
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  We have placed it in our woods.  The pictures that have been taken are clear and precise.  Would recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the buck
Reviews.Author: Matthew Plott "Matt"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras I have bought. I now have 8 and two on the way. very clear pictures and easy to use. I would recommend this camera over any others.

Reviews.Title: Oh the things I have seen
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this to see what animals lurked in the dark around my yard.  I have seen foxes, coyotes, and cats.  The batteries lasted a long time.  Small camera but it takes a good nighttime picture.

Reviews.Title: outside camera
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Atnip
Reviews.Content: I received them in a timely manner. The packing was good. I highly recommend the camera, it was great. I thought camera made a great Christmas gift.

Reviews.Title: Not Exactly as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Faith B Knapp
Reviews.Content: The adjustments are not easily understood, it is not motion sensative thereby running during the time you choose and batteries run out quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Rebecca T. Cranfill
Reviews.Content: Very sharp pics.love it.wish it had a longer range to pick up action but otherwise great product. Would get another one

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Shirley Gaisser
Reviews.Content: I am using this for some stealth security at my business.  Nighttime video is exellent.  Picture mode is ok as long as you dont want it to take pictures of moving targets.  The pictures blur.  Video is crisp.  The infrared lights are not that noticeable in the dark especially if you have the camera above eye level looking down.  nobody looks up.  It blends in well too.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Andrews
Reviews.Content: Takes really good pictures, and love the options on this item.  Really like the clarity for day and night pics.  Night is black & white, but still very clear in seeing whatever comes across the camera.  Able to change the settings to take double pics, or delays.  Great option.

Reviews.Title: This camera takes decent pictures.
Reviews.Author: james Chernosky
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras and they both take decent photos. On one of them I'm unable to disable the field scan so I get a lot of pictures to go through with nothing on them. I will be contacting Bushnell to get this problem corrected. I have other trail cameras made by Wild Game Innovations that cost considerably less and take as good a photo. The other cameras don't have the field scan feature but that's not something I feel is practical for my application.I would not recommend this product based on the price as compared to other brands that perform just as well.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Larry W. Golden
Reviews.Content: I have been using gamecams for over 7 years now and they keep improving every year. I have had to replace other brands every few years due to various ailments and they were large, bulky, and some would have a slow trigger where I would consistantly get pictures of the rear 1/2 of the deer. I have had this little camera  for about 3 weeks now and it takes good pictures, has a good trigger speed, is easy to set up after a few minutes of playing around with it. Don't know how long it will last but it is really neat how small & easy to mount it is and works perfectly. I have now ordered 2 more just like it.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam Standard Edition
Reviews.Author: LARRY MERKEL
Reviews.Content: This camera has worked great. Takes great pictures day or night. This is my second one.wold tell someone else to buy one.

Reviews.Title: High quality pictures
Reviews.Author: B. Parnin "B."
Reviews.Content: This camera has been very easy to use and takes pretty good pictures. I bought it for my technologically challenged father and he has been able to use it with no problems. It's also smaller than a lot of other game cams which I like.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: L. Sutliff
Reviews.Content: This was a great buy and it works fantastic.  I can now take pictures of the critters that crawl around my house in the night.  The camera is wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great photos
Reviews.Author: Naturalist09
Reviews.Content: The camera takes excellent photos but I had a little difficulty getting the setting right to start out. I love the Field scan feature now that I figured it out - it took me some time trying to determine how to set the timeframe for the pictures.  Once I got it set, the camera functioned great.

Reviews.Title: The Only One We Use
Reviews.Author: Kathy Dassow
Reviews.Content: We have 4 of these units now.  We use them year around and wouldn't think of ordering any other brand.  We love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: MK
Reviews.Content: Wokrs great just as advertised. This camera has taken over 250 pictures and the battery meter still reads full much better than my old one.

Reviews.Title: very satisfied
Reviews.Author: beaver
Reviews.Content: I like the compactness and the clarity of the photos. Very economical to operate, as the 8 AA batteries will last a long time. I've had other cameras that use D cell batteries and they have to be changed out every month. I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best game camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Ga Hunter
Reviews.Content: Batteries really last in this thing. I got a whole year and thousands of pics out of the 8 ultimate lithiums I used in it. Pictures are clear and trigger time is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8 Mp
Reviews.Author: D. Breese
Reviews.Content: We have had the camera out for about two weeks and have checked it twice. Both time we had several pictures of deer during the day and night. All the pictures are good quality and clear

Reviews.Title: bushnell trophy cam
Reviews.Author: the grinch
Reviews.Content: Nice camera. This the second one I have purchased.  I had the first one last year and decided to get another early this fall.  Both work very well, trigger time is decent, battery life is good, pics are clear, simple to set. A little hard to see the screen menu in bright sunlight, but that is the only drawback.  I also have two moultries; they do the job, but these out perform them, and are worth the price difference.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Travis Greene
Reviews.Content: This is the first trophy cam I have ever purchased.  I have been hunting deer for a long time, but I never knew exactly what was in the woods I was hunting in.  I set this camera up near a corn pile and I was amazed at what I saw.  It takes amazing pictures in high resolution and you can set it to take pictures at different time intervals.  It will also take short videos.  The case allows you to leave it outside year around and it takes great pictures at any time of day.  I do recommend buying at least a 4GB memory card for it because depending on the setting, it may take a lot of pictures.  For example, I have it taking 2 pictures each time it detects motion and I have taken over 700 pictures in a week.  Also, the camera is perfect for taking pictures of large animals like deer and small animals like raccoons.

Reviews.Title: Camera not working properly
Reviews.Author: southernlady
Reviews.Content: I have owned several of these over the years and loved them.  This one will only hold date programing for a day or two and then resets itself back to 1/1/2011.  It is not taking any pictures now.  The night pictures that it was taking were very grainy.  Nothing like the quality of our older Bushnell Trophy Cams.  Now I have to package it up and send it back to Bushnell and pay for shipping both ways.  I am not a happy customer this time.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Ok case
Reviews.Author: Knavenshue
Reviews.Content: Great trail camera. Photos are excellent, haven't used the video function yet, but as I said the photos are perfect. Motion sensor works great, I often get pictures of birds, racoons, squirrels, and other wildlife as well as deer, my main target. Photo quality is awesome, both daylight and infrared pictures are clear and crisp.  Battery life is supposed to be 1 year but I have found that they usually last about 8000 pictures when running high sensitivity.  Obvisiously this is down a little when working in cold weather, but I usually manage to get close to 7000 pictures out of a set. Case is waterproof and lasted through 3 days of constant rain followed by about four days of being completely covered by snow. My only complaint is the construction of the case,it appears to be made of a cheap plastic that does not hold up very well in cold weather, one of the mounting brackets broke my first use in snow so now it takes some rigging to get the camera to stand straight up. Also the brackets could be placed in much better places ( possible on the sides instead of directly in the center of the back???). As far as the menus, they are easy to follow and quick to navigate. Screen is easy to read meaning it can be programmed in the field without much trouble. Quick to setup, easy to use, great pictures, but still needs some work on the case to make it the perfect 5 star trail cam.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says it does
Reviews.Author: Lisa Patterson
Reviews.Content: I like this.  I'm not a hunter but I bought it to figure out what was eating my chickens.  got lots of photos of deer, raccoon and finally the bobcat that was responsible for some of the losses.  My sons who do hunt use several of Busnells game cameras and they are fairly easy to use.  Of course, if you are hoping for outstanding photos this isn't it.  It does have decent photos and you can tell what is captured if close by.  I had the video set up but it was a bit too sensitive and would take shots when the shadows of leaves moved.  Changed the setting and it helped somewhat.  It's good for what it does.

Reviews.Title: great trail camera
Reviews.Author: sethb
Reviews.Content: very nice trail camera for the money.  Quick trigger speed and multiple settings.  Not much luck with wildgame innovations cameras but this on does very well.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8 MP Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Allard
Reviews.Content: Items came very quickly and have been installed.  Pictures are very clear and detailed. Night shots are very clear and distinct.

Reviews.Title: 3 Months in and it works great
Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: Great photo's in day or night.  Just make sure to review some websites on setting it up in a good place.  Height, angle, trail type, leaves in the way etc can make a big difference.  I bring an HD card reader (iPad) with me while checking cams to make it easier.  It's nice to know right away how much action has been in a specific location.  I'll update the review if I have any problems with weather and failure in our cold Wisconsin winter, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Trail cam
Reviews.Author: Bruce W. Griehm
Reviews.Content: This Bushnell trail camera takes very nice photo's, and was easy to set up, and the battery's seem to be lasting for quite a while... I will buy another one soon..

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam Review
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: Overall a good trail camera. Fast trigger speed, long battery life. I've been comparing side by side the Bushnell to my Primos Blackout (they are mounted on the same tree). The Bushnell captures more deer than the Primos, possibly from the faster trigger speed. The downside of the camera is the day pictures are darker than that of the Primos and the night shots are blurred if the animal is moving. However, if the deer, racoon or possum is standing still during the camera shot, the image is clear enough to make out what it is. I like how small the camera is and it's really easy to program. The next camera I purchase will probably be another Bushnell.

Reviews.Title: Bear Cam!
Reviews.Author: DVD
Reviews.Content: Good value but the controls / readout could be better. Tried to get images of a polar bear, but only got black bears...

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade!
Reviews.Author: MHintl14
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my father after he had gone through 3 moultrie's over the past 2 years (1 battery malfunction/2 lens issues) and I decided to get him a nicer quality one, I researched it on trail camera pro and it looked like it was the best value for the money, the battery life is incredible and the pictures speak for themselves, the 45 foot range was a huge improvement over his last ones. After 2 months of owning it it looks to be a great value, have yet to try the video w/sound yet or the field scan option. its not too bad to set up once you get the menu items down, the only improvement I would say would be the review/delete process. save your money on the bone collector version though especially if you are going to put it in a camo lock box. Absolutely great buy though, my father is an avid hunter and he says its the best camera he's ever had with tons of options and the night time sensitivity works great, no white orbs!

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam - Outstanding
Reviews.Author: C. G. "Upper Hand"
Reviews.Content: The Bushnell 8MB Trophy Cam IR trail camera is a great combination of functionality and simplicity. Setup is a breeze and only takes a minute or two. First night after placing the camera where I suspected deer activity it caught an 8-point Buck at about 10pm at night. Image was nice and clear and the rack was clearly visible. IR flash is more than adequate and can capture objects 50-75 ft. away. The camera takes nice sharp daytime photos as well.Some other user comments noted that the shutter was audible - from the testing I did before placing the trail cam near my hunting location, rest assured that the camera is dead silent. Based on the fact it took 6 great photos of a buck (that was with a 10 second reset delay) on the first night the camera was installed is proof that the cam does not spook deer.Nothing negative to write about this camera after the first few days of use. It does exactly what it was designed to do and does it well. Bushnell makes a great product and I'd highly recommend this camera for anyone wanting to improve their hunting strategy this season.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Stuff
Reviews.Content: The Bushnell Trophy Cam works just as described. Excellent day time pictures and very clear B&W; pictures at night. Good quality for the money.

Reviews.Title: Less than I expected.
Reviews.Author: joseph h. stroud
Reviews.Content: The clarity was just not there.  Sometimes the subject would have past the viewing area before recording started .I should have done more research.  I would rate it as fair.

Reviews.Title: Even better than expected
Reviews.Author: Adam Readel
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it, I bought two, I am about to order a third. High Quality day and night photos and it takes SD cards up to 32 gigs, which means literally thousands of photos or hours of video. If buying this camera I recommend you also buy [...]Also, an unexpected feature I like, it runs on 4 OR 8 AA batteries - I can't remember ever seeing anything that did that before. Another thing that is great is the IR flash, which if you've seen photos taken by a trail camera that uses a traditional flash you know the animals are often reacting to the flash in those photos and always seem to look startled - now I notice sometimes deer will stare straight into this thing so they must know its going off (there is a visible dull red light) but most of the time they act like they have no idea it's there at all.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Cam
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Very poor instructions having a hard time figuring it out.  Range is poor on it.  Set up camera and unable to get any pictures taken on it

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: EWB
Reviews.Content: It provided good results on the 1st night.  If the set-up was easier I would have scored it as a 5 star product.  Experience with the set-up mode should be expected.  We like it.

Reviews.Title: Trigger speed
Reviews.Author: W. E. Smotherman
Reviews.Content: Trigger speed was slow for my application. Subjects moving at moderate speed would be missed. Camera probably fine for most applications. Price and other features are great.

Reviews.Title: My third unit like this, must I say more?
Reviews.Author: For the people
Reviews.Content: I have three of these cameras, the first one I bought has been outdoors since December 2011, taking pics nearly every day. Same batteries using it as still shots only and not video mode. One of my two cameras that I purchased and put in use in early July 2012 has been set in the "video/field scan every 60 minutes modes" and has taken nearly 220, 1 minute videos using the same batteries. All functions are working well.

Reviews.Title: Solid, functional camera
Reviews.Author: MichiganderOfNote
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Bushnell camera to monitor raccoons who were molesting my chicken coop at night. The unit works well for this purpose. I use the included strap to attach the camera to a bird feeder near my coops. One note - if you use rechargable batteries, do be sure they are fully charged. My experience had pics with wildly incorrect date & time stamps. I replaced the batteries and have had no problem since. Very simple to download the pictures to a computer via the included USB cable - don't even have to turn the unit on. I purchased mine with one of Amazon's 32Gb memory cards & could probably take a year's worth of shots on it. All in all, a good deal on a solidly functional camera, recommended.

Reviews.Title: Trophy Cam 8meg
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: Clear pictures, easy set-up.  Space your shots if you leave the camera out for a long time. I own 3 now and haven't had any problems.  One camera that was shipped had a bad screen but Amazon replaced it immediately.  Buy from Amazon's site.

Reviews.Title: Good image quality
Reviews.Author: A. Dobe
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple of weeks now.  Mostly I have used it to see what my dogs do when I'm away, but the performance is impressive.  The sensitivity is good, and the image quality for daylight shots is excellent.  (Night images are a little grainy, but not bad.)  I have used the interval capture feature to make some fairly decent time-lapse videos of flowers opening in my garden -- something I did not know the camera could do until I read the manual.  All in all this is a very good camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: AJ whiteshirt
Reviews.Content: Does alot for the money. Would recommend.I wish they had enhanceed features though, for instance:1. Still photos up to 3 shots only. Should be whatever you want to set it at.2. Video up to 60 seconds only. Should be whatever you want to set it.Hope you are listening Bushnell.Otherwise totally happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: bushnell
Reviews.Content: Bought one 2 years ago, worked flawlessly, and only put new batteris in once.  I had it stolen, so got a new one and must be problems with sensor, took 4500 pictures in first 2 days out, going to send back and get replacement.

Reviews.Title: camforall
Reviews.Author: texascam
Reviews.Content: This product seems reliable and sturdy, takes good pictures with relatively good sensitivity.  Slide switch is difficult to operate, and the latches on the cover are difficult to open.  I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Very Compact
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, day photos are fantastic. as for the night photos i would recommend the full color white flash version of the camera it offers better range and better night photo quality. although the IR version is not bad, i would still recommend this camera to a friend. for reviews on cameras check out this site.[...]

Reviews.Title: Deer Cam
Reviews.Author: C. Rick Teter
Reviews.Content: Does a great job as advertised.  Read the other reviews, you can't go wrong.  The night pics are a little grainy at times, but great enough.  I am in eastern Ohio, very cold, but the cam keeps on ticking.  Listen, I looked at many different models, this is the one and moderately priced.

Reviews.Title: This camera works very well.
Reviews.Author: Jelly Jar
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift and my husband was happy with it.  It takes good photos, even at night. It was also easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY IN SOUTH TEXAS
Reviews.Author: CAVJOCK22
Reviews.Content: SO FAR SO GOOD.. It has taken about 1600 pics in a month and a half with no problems.. Still has plenty of battery life..There are some blank shots but Id say only 2%,,, Lots of pics.. The early morn: 6:30-7:00, pic quality is fair but all other times pics are great.. I have not used any other setting or video capability.. just pics..  I went ahead and ordered a second camera since Im having great success with it so far for another feeder....  Set up is very easy..  Great Produce to far...

Reviews.Title: Great Trail Camera
Reviews.Author: Kat "Beau's Mom"
Reviews.Content: This camera operates as advertised and the pictures are fantastic.  It is easy to set up in various modes for each different application.  I would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Game Cam
Reviews.Author: cavaliermom
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband, he has used it for several months. It works great, nice pics, he is thrilled!

Reviews.Title: Software glitch that I can't fix.
Reviews.Author: bigkirb1
Reviews.Content: Overall I am happy with my trophy cam.  Some minor improvements from Bushnell could make it much better though; like more LEDs, especially for night vision, more motion detection settings, and faster delay intervals.  My only problem is that windows media won't read video right so I installed DIVX which mostly corrected the problem.  It still comes up with an error message, but at least I can see the videos.  I tried Bushnells support patch, but it didn't take.  If bushnell wants to be player, its product has to be perfect right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: great for a first camera
Reviews.Author: RSlater04
Reviews.Content: For being the first trail camera i've ever owned and not being able to compare it to others, id say it get's a A-.A little hard to use with some awkward buttons and lots of confusing directions. There are several different modes to run it in and each one is for a different setting which is a little confusing as well. Other than that it takes great pictures with accurate detail up to roughly 100+ yards.

Reviews.Title: LIARS sent wrong model.  SCAM ALERT!
Reviews.Author: Jt M.
Reviews.Content: WARNING!!!!  The product description lists a 119436C Trail Camera with the covert [invisible] black flash!  The product sent was a 119436 with the bright red infrared flash - a much cheaper model!  The seller purposefully lied in the product description hoping  to mislead...hoping people wouldn't notice the cheaper model trick, or hoping people wouldn't want to deal with the hassels of returning!  This is fraud at its most direct and obvious and whoever is responsible can send me the appropriate model immediately with all postage costs for returns paid by them.  This is a serious crime and a terrible scam.  I feel cheated and ripped off by ILLEGAL criminal behavior and I want it rectified immediately!

Reviews.Title: PITA
Reviews.Author: Ron PA
Reviews.Content: Picked up the neighbors cat ok as it staked out my birdfeeder and prowled around at night but the unit had a lot of deficiencies and some misrepresentations. Just reading the back of the package reveals a lot of bs:-"Widescreen": is only due to vertical being cropped; very limited up and down view means you often have to choose between a large view of terrain or aiming it downward to catch what's nearby.-"Advanced Ultra-compact design": REALLY? It's a big box that stands out like a sore thumb; other cams have "advanced" flat-backed oval shapes to blend in on a tree.-"Trigger speed 1 second": seems more like 3; I pushed a wheelbarrow full of firewood past it numerous times and it barely catches me in the frame.Other complaints:-Date/time stamp on video is only on the first frame or two; no way to read it without pausing playback on every clip. Very annoying.-The batteries come loose easily and often need reseating after mounting the camera. I think that's why it didn't do field scans as programmed but still caught me going and coming back after 6 days.-10 second delay between turn-on and active mode is an annoyance because I spend a minute or two positioning and concealing it.-The IR-LED bank glows red on activation; an attention grabbing feature that may prompt people to steal, bears to maul and coyotes to avoid these cameras; 'black-out' type models are advertised without this problem and would be preferable.-A simple security feature in the firmware could register this camera to it's rightful owner and disable it for thieves; negligent to omit it imo. Not even a molded-in s/n; just a sticker. Make a little effort here Bushnell. (I subtly scratched my name on mine.)-Video and multi-pic settings are nice for sensor-activated shots but for periodic field scan shots are just wasteful and it's a major deficiency that there's only an all-or-nothing selection.Picture, video and audio quality are all pretty good except for twilight conditions where pics are often washed out, which also happens occassionally during daylight shots for some reason.I take along an assortment of color and camo tape to help conceal the camera in a particular environment and I'll consider material from worn out camo clothes when hunting season nears and the woods get crowded but this thing is big and boxy and difficult to conceal very well.Twice now it ended up taking a pic a minute 24/7 though field scan was set to 15 minutes; thousands of pics to go through.Overall: I'm finding trail-camming an interesting hobby even with this pita camera, but if I get another it will have to be much better designed than this one.

Reviews.Title: Mine Died 1st Year
Reviews.Author: John Guess
Reviews.Content: Worked great for about 3 months. Then the display quit working.It was useless after that.  I can't comment on customer service because after that it went in the trash. No more Bushnell products for me.

Reviews.Title: First Trophy Cam - Great!
Reviews.Author: Susan Nevers
Reviews.Content: Got this as recommendation from my sister who has the camo color in the 1 step down version.  Great quality - fun to see the pix.

Reviews.Title: Trail Cam
Reviews.Author: Mountain Dan
Reviews.Content: This was a gift from my wife. I am so pleased with its performance. Crystal clear pictures and did not malfunction.

Reviews.Title: Not what we had expected
Reviews.Author: Paula Markland
Reviews.Content: This product picks up too much noise and takes pictures of nothing.  Everytime the wind blew the camera would go off.  I don't think we would purchase again

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with first camera satisfied with second
Reviews.Author: Slag Runner
Reviews.Content: The first camera shipped promptly and arrived by the promise date.Upon receipt I loaded 8 AA batteries and an 8GB SD card (it can accommodate up to a 32GB card)and went through set up to get exactly the settings I wanted.  No Problems.  Set up  instructions were clear and the process was somewhat intuitive.  After adjusting the camera just the way I wanted it I attached it to a a small tripod using the threaded socket in the base of the unit and set it outside on a stone retaining wall near my home. I pointed the camera towards a dark space between my house and an adjoining building.  A few hours after dark I walked in front of the camera to check it out and noted that the IR lights emitted a soft red glow as I came within range of the motion detector.  The next morning I retrieved the camera and easily removed the SD card, popped it into a slot on my computer and read the contents.  There were about 6 still images on the card.  A couple from when I was setting the camera and a couple from when I was retrieving the camera.  There was also a clear photo of me, time stamped at 20:33 the night before, taken when I walked in front of it just to check it out.  There was also a very clear photo of a large raccoon taken at 20:46.  I was pleased with the results.The problem arose when I tried to change a few of the set up options.  The three way switch that controls off/setup/on was defective.  With a lot of tender manipulation I could get the camera to go back and forth between off and on but it would not go into the middle position, which is the setup mode.Really irked me.  I liked everything else about the camera but the switch is a real weak point in the design and construction of the unit. It is flimsy and does not click into any position.  Its operation is very mushy.I sent the camera back for a replacement (Amazon was no problem to deal with), with the hopes that the replacement unit will be more reliable.  If it is not, I will have to return it for a refund.UPDATE SEPTEMBER 29, 2012Exchange was straightforward, no problems or complaints.The new (replacement) camera has a three way switch that is modestly improved compared to the broken one which I returned, but after several days of use it seems to be fully serviceable.I have the camera set on NORMAL sensitivity (options are high, normal, or low).  I have it set on 8 megapixel still images and 3 images per triggering event (taken at one second intervals).  Its night time performance has been very good.  There has not been a single false trigger since I set it out.  The nights here have been very cool (40 to 50 degrees and very still).  I know this sort of weather provides optimum environmental conditions for the camera's night time use. I will be interested to see how it performs in the heat of summer.So far the camera has captured rabbits and racoons (as well as me setting up and checking on the camera).  Range is excellent.  Image quality at night is very good out to about 40 feet.  Dark images are discernible from 40 feet out to about 50 feet.  Pitch black beyond 50 feet.  Daylight images are excellent for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Yup
Reviews.Content: I believe this unit is working perfectly, as of now. Only used it once, though, so will have to wait until I use it a little more to really see if it's ok.

Reviews.Title: OK for the price
Reviews.Author: Jimmy
Reviews.Content: Too many batteries, too technical to program. The pictures and video are very clear but you may have to mess with it several times before you get it right. For the price, well. A lot better products out there.

Reviews.Title: critter catcher
Reviews.Author: John R. "DESERT RAT"
Reviews.Content: i have not had s chance to use this yet.  we don't go camping in the moutains in the winter.

Reviews.Title: need more information for use
Reviews.Author: Greg Dannels
Reviews.Content: Works fine, but would be nice to have directions telling how to view the pictures on the chip on the camera screen rather than downloading to a computer.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: Jake Hunter
Reviews.Content: This product has excellent battery life if you use 8 AA lithium batteries and only use it for the camera mode.  I have two camera that have exceeded 2 years of battery life.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT
Reviews.Author: Danny R. Guill
Reviews.Content: Works great I am using for security. The only issue is night time I cannot read license numbers. The rest of time I can pick up lic numbers and easily read on my computer.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: irishwonka
Reviews.Content: I bought these for surveillance on my property. Had people breaking in to my my barn, shop and cars.  Bam! Put these babies up and caught me some thief's! Download pics to computer and email to sheriffs office. Pictures have time and date stamp on photos, so there's  no doubt when it was taken unless you set the date wrong. They are small and easy to hide. Take very good night time and even better day time pics. They are about the size of your hand. Battery life is pretty good. Took 3876 pictures on one cam in two weeks and still 3/4 of the battery life left. Overall great product. Easy to set up. Easy to maintain.  Would by again!

Reviews.Title: GOOD LITTLE CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: R. Reyes
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT IT MORE FOR A SECURITY CAMERA. IT IS NOT THE GREATEST FOR THAT, BUT AS A TRAIL CAMERA I'M SURE IT DOES THE JOB!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: handy man 2
Reviews.Content: I have been testing the camera and like the results. The night pictures are not as good as my primos camera but, the battery life is much better than my primos camera, which is very important to me.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Angiep
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband for Valentines Day and he is totally happy. He loves this trail camera. It was way better than the one he had that has seen it's better days. Will be buying him another one in April for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: Junky Camera
Reviews.Author: jvandevender2003
Reviews.Content: To be an 8mp camera, it doesnt take very good pics, a couple hours in the morning and evening the pics are very dark I dont know if it is trying to transition from infrared to colored pics or if it is trying to go from colored pics to infrared. Even the good pics are not very clear, I tried all the different settings from 3mp to 8mp and no change. I had a Moultrie 4mp i40 and it was the best camera i ever had even after a bear ripped it up, rained in it and filled it with water and it still worked for about one more year and finally crashed. After reading all the great reviews on the bushnell i thought i would give it a try and i am going to try to find another i40. The good things about the bushnell is that everytime it takes a pic there is always something there and it is very easy on batteries. I have probably had the camera for too long or i would send it back for an exchange.

Reviews.Title: Does Its Job
Reviews.Author: Chicago007
Reviews.Content: Used the camera for about a month and so far, it seems to do what it is suppose to do. Pictures and time lapse video (using the software)are clear. Night shots are not as good as day shots. Camera is very easy to use. My 15 year old was able to work it without any problems. The only complaint I have is that for the price I paid ($158.00), I think a tripod and/or carrying case should have been included.

Reviews.Title: did our homework.
Reviews.Author: Hookedon SOA
Reviews.Content: poor picture quality.  First  time trail cam  user so we don't have anything to compare it to.  Bought to capture wildlife in back yard.  In  one month have caught one glimpse of a deer.  we know there's more out there.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: tom davis
Reviews.Content: this is the best thing sense who knows when.. why having this fixes just about everything..so now i just have to have a few more great things.. and i will be set..!!

Reviews.Title: Returned it
Reviews.Author: MThomas
Reviews.Content: Never opened the box. Returned it for the newer model. Will be a good deal for someone down the road when it goes on sale.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trophy Cam adequate but.a challenge to instal
Reviews.Author: Lon Thomas
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam along with the Bushnell Bear Safe Security Case and and Master Lock 8417D with the idea of checking out the deer and turkey population. All arrived in excellent condition and assembly and set up appeared easy enough. I planned to attach the security case to a tree with lag screws drop in the camera and start scouting counting horns. So here is the problem - I could not get the camera to slide into the case with the lag screws installed. Turns out that there is a small plastic piece protruding from the back of the camera designed to hold the camera away from the tree if you are not using the security case. Unfortunately, the design seems poor so the camera won't fit into the security case which was supposedly designed for this product, if you attach it to an object with lag screws. Options would be to attach the case to the tree with the strap provided for the camera, consider flat head screws, or cut off the plastic support piece from the camera back. I chose the latter and soon found that the plastic tab is hollow thus creating a 5X4 mm hole in the camera back. Fortunately, I was able to seal the hole with some plastic filler from the auto parts store and the camera then fit well into the security case. I then passed the lock cable 8471D through the security case and once again the camera would not fit! No big deal as the case comes with a lock so I just eliminated the cable. I certainly would not waste money buying the lock cable again.After I finally was able to install the camera and case, I was satisfied with its performance. B&W; photos are surprisingly clear - easily able to see animals and count points which is all I really need. The daytime color photos are somewhat blurry but this may be partially due to wind moving leaves etc. as no wildlife was in the frame. Burned through the first set of eight AAs in about 3 weeks so expect to buy plenty of batteries if you plan to leave it in the field all fall.

Reviews.Title: When it worked it was only barely
Reviews.Author: John L. Werner
Reviews.Content: It had slow response time missing many shots. It routinely missed humans, and who knows what animals.  The final blow was that the camera could used the SD card. Tried several others and it failed. Tried to access the SD card via USB port. Nope, it could see it. Too bad the quality was poor and menu was very good. I we be hunting for a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell
Reviews.Author: Panosso
Reviews.Content: I bought 26 câmeras and recieve 1 packaging with 23. The guys of the hotel said that there isn`t another packaging. In the next day I came to guys in the hotel and ask again to another package and, finally they found the second package. Now, it's alright

Reviews.Title: Poor choice
Reviews.Author: Huntsman
Reviews.Content: I spent a significant amount of time researching remote stand alone cameras.  I decided on this one based on reviews, trade name, published features, capacity, and price.  I have used this camera for almost a year for days at a time.  This is by for the worst performing electronic device I have ever owned.  Other bad electronic devices I have purchased, that did not cost this much, either never worked or worked as advertise for a short period of time before failure.  This camera has never worked as advertised and is really an expensive ripoff.  My suggestion is too save your money, spend more, and get a "real" camera.  I don't want warranties and guarantees, I want function as advertised, period.

Reviews.Content: Dag on this here is the best thang I ever seen.  I wish it shot bullets cuz Id never have to get out of bed.  Go out in my truck pick up them dead critters and feed to the yunguns.  And Id have a picture to show the cuzzins

Reviews.Content: It takes pictures when it wants and so many nothing is coming to the feeder. Would like it fixed but, duh.

Reviews.Title: Help us, you are our only hope. You are the resistance
Reviews.Author: Captain R.J. Tuscaloosa of 101 Company
Reviews.Content: TRANSMISSION TIME: 2.09YEAR: 2137AUTHOR: CAPTAIN R.J. TUSCALOOSA OF 101 COMPANYBASE: OMEGA STATION ZETA 5The rise came after the french civil war of 2116. If you are reading this, you are the resistance. They came from the sky. Thousands of them. Slaying humanity for our resources, using us as food. We were over run in days. Supplies were scarce. Entire countries collapsed in hours. Those who survived fight with the resistance. The Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam Brown Night Vision Trail Camera allows us to capture images in the darkness and night. It's safer in the dark for the creatures eyesight faults in the shadow. But there is still time. In the year 2057, humanity will come in contact with an alien race know as the Yijirtyl. Please, do not trust them. They're soldiers will drop down from the sky and consume our planet. Please, if you are reading this, there is still hope, there is still time. Humanity can live forever. Beware of these Yirjirtyls, for they will destroy our world and our lives. Our technology Only permits us one message every three years, if you do not hear from the resistance by 2014 your time, all is lost. This is Captain R.J. Tuscaloosa of 101 Company.TRANSMISSION WILL END IN 5 SECONDS...4321Comment
